folio_text: Below a plaque with the inscription/ NUMQUID NON IPSE EST PATER TUUS/ the Ark of the Covenant stands on an altar-table in a recess before a reredos adorned with bas-reliefs of allegorical figures alternating with composite pilasters/ Columns and fringed curtains drawn to the sides frame the entrance/ There is a quatrain below//Frame consists of bands of burnished and dull gold/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 196r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 198r
folio_text: Below a plaque/ framed in gold/ with the inscription/ GENUIT NOS VERBO VERITATIS/ bunches of grapes and sheaves of wheat emerge from acanthus ornament (leaves) on either side of a cherub’s head/ Within an arched frame/ from which hangs a garland of flowers/ a monstrance stands on an altar-table inscribed with the monogram IHS surmounted by the cross/ The IHS/ with cross/ and MA monograms appear on the base/ Vases of flowers and candle stands with candlesticks and candles are arranged on either side/ A fringed curtain is held up by the arms of a cross/ to which the sponge/ and crown of thorns are attached/ There is a quatrain/ edged in gold/ against a marble plinth//Frame consists of bands of burnished and dull gold bands/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 200r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 202r
folio_text: Below a plaque with the motto/ ET IPSE TAMQUAM SPONSUS/ the Ark of the Covenant rests on an altar within a pilastered apse/ At the entrance four panels show winged/ allegorical figures in bas-relief/ Before the apse a pair of columns/ on bases with scenes of small figures/ support fringed curtains drawn to the sides above a tessellated floor/ There is a quatrain below//Frame consists of bands of burnished and dull gold bands/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 204r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 206r
folio_text: Underneath a plaque with the inscription/ ECCE SPONSUS VENIT/ there is an arched frame/ below the sky/ on which rests two vases of flowers/ including tulips and roses/ and a covered container framed by bay or laurel leaves at the top/ Under a garland of flowers and gold fringed curtains drawn to the sides/ a monstrance stands on an altar-table flanked by flowers emerging from gold acanthus ornaments and emblems of the Passion/ including the cross with titulus and crown of thorns and lance on the left and ladder and column on the right/ There is a quatrain below//Frame consists of bands of burnished and dull gold bands/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 208r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 210r
folio_text: At the top/ ribbons and a garland of flowers/ drawing butterflies/ dragonflies/ and other insects/ frame a verse/ the motto/ and a medallion/ enclosing the Burning Bush/ Below the medallion there is a flaming brazier/ flanked by vases of flowers which include tulips and daffodils/ Additional verses appear on a plaque below//Golden three bar frame/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 212r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 214r
folio_text: At the top/ gold scrolls and acanthus ornament frame a verse and medallion containing the seven branched candelabrum of Moses/ A garland of flowers weaves between the motto above and down the sides of the medallion and its stand/ Hanging lamps and candlesticks are on either side/ Below are additional verses//Golden three bar frame/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 216r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 218r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 220r
folio_text: Against a gold ground/ a pelican feeding her three young/ rests on a garland of grapes and sheaves of wheat over an oval with an inscription/ Below/ acanthus ornaments support a garland of flowers and sprigs of tulips and roses//Frame consists of bands of burnished gold/ dull gold/ and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 224r
La vérité à la place des ombresFrance/ Paris/ 1679MS M/21 fol/ 224v
Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 1v
folio_text: Evangelist Mark/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ stands next to lectern on which is open book; books are also in compartment below/ Evangelist symbol (lion) is behind him/ Bookshelves with curtains are to right of lectern/Figure in vaulted room with windows/ and with arched opening to rocky landscape/ Grisaille miniature with color accents/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 14v
folio_text: Mary Magdalen/ nimbed/ holding ointment jar/ stands in landscape with city buildings in background/ including church/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 17v
folio_text: Christ/ crossed nimbus/ raising right hand in blessing/ holding with left hand/ open book facing out/ stands with globe at His feet/ At left angel (?) with joined hands kneels in doorway/ Outside is eagle (?) holding scroll in beak/Figures in room with vaulted ceiling/ windows and arched doorway to exterior/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 29v
folio_text: Evangelist John/ nimbed/ raises right hand in blessing/ holds with left hand chalice in which is black figure (?)/ Evangelist symbol (eagle) is at right/Figures in vaulted room or church with draped altar/ windows/ tile floor/Miniature in grisaille with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 32v
folio_text: Christopher of Lycia: carrying Christ Child -- Christopher of Lycia/ nimbed/ both hands grasping staff/ walks through water with Christ Child/ crossed nimbus/ raising right hand/ holding globe with left hand/ seated on Christopher's left shoulder/ At right is hermit raising both hands behind rock/ City is in background/Miniature in grisaille with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 35v
folio_text: Thomas ³l Becket: murdered before High Altar -- Thomas Becket/ nimbed/ bleeding from wound in head/ with joined hands raised/ kneels next to draped altar on which is chalice/ Behind him are one man and two soldiers/ one of whom raises bloody sword with his right hand/Scene in vaulted church with windows and open arched doorway/ Miniature in grisaille with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 38v
folio_text: Anna/ Virgin Mary and Christ Child -- Anna/ nimbed and veiled with wimple/ is seated with open book on right knee/ extending right arm toward angel holding gold object/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed and crowned/ sits at left knee of Anna/ holding with both hands/ nude Christ Child/ crossed nimbus/Scene in vaulted room with windows/ Miniature in grisaille with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 40v
folio_text: Before cloth of honor/ Catherine of Alexandria/ nimbed and crowned/ holding sword with right hand/ stands on man/ wearing hat/ possibly Maxentius/ Broken (?) wheel is behind her/Figures in vaulted room with windows and closed door/ Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 42v
folio_text: Barbara of Nicomedia/ nimbed/ holding palm with right hand and book with left hand/ stands next to tower/ City is in background/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 44v
folio_text: Christ: in Gethsemane and Christ: Betrayal/ Arrival in Garden -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ with joined hands raised/ kneels before rock on which is chalice/ Above Him in arc of Heaven/ amid rays/ is bust of God/ crossed nimbus/ Behind Christ three Apostles/ nimbed/ sit on ground/ eyes shut/ Outside of fence surrounding garden/ is group of men and soldiers/ four carrying spears/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 55v
folio_text: Christ: Betrayal and Arrest and Apostle/ Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Judas/ stands close to right side of Christ/ crossed nimbus/ Christ extends right hand toward Malchus/ bleeding from right side of head/ kneeling/ holding lantern with left hand/ Apostle Peter/ nimbed/ stands over him/ raising sword with right hand/ Two soldiers are at left/ eight are at right/ three holding spears/ foremost touching robe of Christ/ City is in background/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 74v
folio_text: Christ: before Pilate -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ His hands covered and bound/ flanked by two soldiers/ stands before Pilate/ wearing hat/ raising right hand/ holding scepter with left hand/ sitting on throne/ At left stand five soldiers/ three holding spears/Scene in vaulted room with windows and door open to exterior/ Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 80v
folio_text: Christ: Flagellation -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ wearing short loincloth/ body covered with sores/ stands with back to column/ hands bound behind Him/ He is flanked by two torturers raising scourges in right hands/Scene in room with windows and arched doorway to exterior/ Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 85v
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ carries cross on right shoulder/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ touches arm of cross with right hand/ Evangelist John/ nimbed/ walks beside her/ At right are eight soldiers/ two carrying spears/ the foremost holding rope attached to Christ/ City is in background/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 89v
folio_text: Christ: Crucifixion -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ eyes shut/ bleeding from wounds/ wearing short/ diaphanous loincloth is affixed with three nails to cross/ At left are Evangelist John/ Virgin Mary/ veiled/ possibly swooning/ and Holy Woman/ all nimbed/ At right are man/ wearing hat/ and soldier with saber at waist/ City is in background/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 94v
folio_text: Christ: Entombment -- Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus/ hold body of Christ/ crossed nimbus/ bleeding from wounds/ on cloth above sarcophagus/ Virgin Mary/ Holy Woman and Evangelist John/ all nimbed/ stand at side of tomb/ John looks away/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/ Scene in landscape with city in background/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 113v
folio_text: Christ: Last Judgment -- Amid stars/ Christ/ crossed nimbus/ raising right hand/ extending left hand/ sits on arc with his feet on tripartite globe/ His body is partially draped in mantle/ showing bleeding wounds/ Christ is flanked above by busts of two angels/ rays as nimbi/ blowing trumpets and below by Virgin Mary/ veiled/ and Evangelist John (?)/ both nimbed and with joined hands/ Heads/ accompanied by joined hands/ emerge from ground/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 137v
folio_text: Scene/ Liturgical: Obsequies -- Four clerics/ tonsured/ wearing copes/ the foremost gesturing/ stand before lectern on which is open book/ Next to lectern is draped bier flanked by two candles/ In background is draped altar/ Scene in vaulted church with windows and tile floor/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ Bruges/ ca/ 1460-1470MS M/25 fol/ 171v
folio_text: Personification: Soul/ borne to Heaven -- Half figure of God/ crossed nimbus/ raising right hand in blessing/ holding tripartite globe with left hand/ in mandorla of rays/ appears in arc of Heaven with rays/ Below are two nude souls/ with joined hands in napkin held by two angels/ hovering above two open graves in ground/Grisaille miniature with gold and color details/Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 16r
folio_text: Evangelist/ John: Scene/ on Patmos -- On island with rocky outcrop/ Evangelist symbol (eagle)/ wings spread/ stands next to Evangelist John/ nimbed/ seated/ with right hand writes in open book held with left hand on his lap/ Pen case is on ground between them/ Above/ bust of God/ nimbed/ appears in arc of heaven ringed with heads and wings of red angels/ In background/ ship and small boats/ and across water/ walled harbor with city and castle in mountains in distance/Miniature in arched frame supported by two columns/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ strawberry/ dianthus/ and thistle/ and inhabited by bird/ fly/ hybrid man with face on abdomen/ and dog wearing collar/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 18v
folio_text: Evangelist Luke/ nimbed/ is seated on canopied throne/ decorated with fleur-de-lis/ before desk with scroll hanging over top/ Below seat of throne is book storage/ Evangelist symbol (ox) lies next to him on floor/ Scene in windowed room/Miniature within frame of poly-lobe arch supported by two colonnettes and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by bird/ bird pecking at fly/ and frog/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 20v
folio_text: Evangelist Matthew/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ is seated on throne/ resting right hand on scroll on his lap/ left hand exgended to book held by Evangelist symbol (angel)/Miniature within frame of poly-lobed arch supported by clusters of colonnettes and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches and strawberry/ and inhabited by birds/ bird pecking at fly/ snail/ and grasshopper/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 22v
folio_text: Evangelist Mark/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ is seated/ holding quill in right hand/ left hand holding open book on his lap/ Beside him Evangelist symbol (lion) is on floor/ Behind him is cupboard (?) on top of which stand two books/ Scene within room with colonnade open to exterior/Miniature framed by quadri-lobe arch supported by twisted and decorated columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ strawberry and dianthus/ and inhabited by hybrid animal/ birds/ moth/ and duck/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 24r
folio_text: Bernard of Clairvaux: Scene/ Victory over the Devil -- Bernard of Clairvaux/ nimbed/ wearing hood and habit/ holds book in left hand and in right hand/ crozier and chain/ Chain is attached to collar around neck of devil/ holding rod in right hand/ with second face in groin/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by snail and hybrid animals/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 26r
folio_text: Gregory the Great: Scene/ celebrating Mass -- Gregory the Great/ nimbed and tonsured/ wearing priest's vestments/ kneels at draped altar/ resting elbows on altar/ holding host (wafer) in raised hands/ He is flanked by two clerics/ tonsured/ wearing deacon's vestments/ kneeling/ one extending right hand/ the other holding candle in right hand and bottom of chasuble with left hand/ On altar/ open book and triple crowned papal tiara flank chalice into which blood of Christ flows from wound in His side/ Christ/ wearing crown of thorns/ is supported by angel/ and displays wounds in hands/ Above and behind altar are instruments of Passion/ including pincers/ cross with titulus INRI surmounted by three dice/ shroud over arm of cross/ coins/ lantern/ hammer/ and column/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by snail and birds/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 38r
folio_text: Christ: Piet³l -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ wearing wimple/ is seated/ holding Christ/ rays as nimbus/ with crown of thorns/ eyes closed/ showing wounds/ partially draped/ She supports Him with right hand under His right arm/ and holds His left hand with her left hand/ Behind them is cross with titulus INRI/ In background is rocky landscape with city/Initial S containing two snails/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ strawberry and dianthus/ and inhabited by bird pecking snail/ birds/ hybrid animal and hybrid man/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 46v
folio_text: Corpse/ possibly personification of death/ with deteriorating skin/ through which skeleton is visible/ emerges from sarcophagus on ground in walled area/ Mountains with buildings in background/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 48r
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Before tent-like canopy/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneels at draped prie-dieu on which is open book/ She rests her right hand on book/ raises left hand and looks toward Archangel Gabriel/ extending fleur-de-lis scepter left hand and holding with right hand scroll inscribed AVE GRACIA PLENA DOMINUS TECUM/ Scene is in windowed room with wooden ceiling; in upper window is bust of God/ nimbed/ raising right hand in blessing and holding cross-surmounted globe in left hand/ Rays extend from God to Virgin Mary/ and support dove of Holy Ghost/Miniature within arched frame supported by pairs of colonnettes and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ thistle/ dianthus and strawberry/ and inhabited by bird/ dog with collar/ monkey possibly wearing cardinal's hat and collar/ hybrid man wearing hood with horns/ playing bagpipe/ and moth/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 71v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Visitation -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ extends her left hand to Elizabeth/ nimbed and veiled/ her right hand on abdomen of Virgin Mary/ In background is landscape with trees and path/ and building or city/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by moth/ hybrid animals/ bird/ and snail/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 86r
folio_text: Christ: Betrayal and Arrest and Apostle/ Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Christ/ nimbed/ holding ear of Malchus in right hand/ is embraced and kissed by Judas/ At left/ Apostle Peter/ nimbed/ sheaths sword/ standing behind Malchus/ bleeding from right side of head/ kneeling/ supporting himself with right hand/ holding lantern with left hand/ All are surrounded by soldiers wearing helmets and armor/ one with sheathed sword at waist/ others holding spears/ two holding torches/ In background is tall square arch/ and city/ all beneath starry sky with crescent moon/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ rose/ viola/ and strawberry/ and inhabited by birds/ and hybrid animals/ one snapping at fly/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 88r
folio_text: Pentecost -- Before tent-like canopy/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneels at draped prie-dieu on which is open book/ her hands resting on book/ At right are three (?) Holy Women (?)/ nimbed/ and veiled/ one orant/ and 13 (?) Apostles/ nimbed/ one kneeling/ one orant/ one with hands joined/ Some look up toward dove of Holy Ghost/ nimbed/ hovering amid rays and tongues of flame/ All within room decorated with architectural detail/Miniature within gold frame with trilobe arch at top/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and dianthus/ and inhabited by goose/ upright cat holding bellows under right front leg/ and wildman/ wearing hood/ playing lute/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 90r
folio_text: Christ: Nativity and Shepherds: Adoration -- Christ Child/ nimbed/ nude/ lying amid rays on draped manger/ is flanked by Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneeling/ with joined hands/ and by Joseph the Carpenter/ kneeling on one knee/ holding candle between fingers of left hand and shielding flame with right hand/ Next to manger are ox and ass/ Behind/ two shepherds/ one wearing hood/ each holding staff/ stand at window behind wattle wall/ Above manger/ rays emerge from roof of shed/ extending to Christ Child/ and two angels hover/ both holding scroll with pseudo-inscription/ Scene within roofed shed with holes in wall/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by bird and hybrid animals/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 96r
folio_text: Christ: Flagellation -- Christ/ rays as crossed nimbus/ wearing short loincloth/ stands before column/ his hands behind Him/ flanked by two torturers/ wearing hats/ one raising scourge with both hands/ the other striking Him with withes/ Scene in windowed apsidal space with stone floor/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ rose and dianthus/ and inhabited by bird and hybrid animals/ one wearing hat/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 99r
folio_text: Shepherds: Annunciation -- One of two shepherds is seated on ground/ holding pedum in right hand and raising left hand/ The other/ wearing cap/ holding pedum in left hand/ with right hand indicates/ and looks up towards/ angel/ amid rays/ hovering/ holding with both hands/ scroll with pseudo-inscription/ Scene in landscape with sheep/ hills with trees/ and city in background/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ rose and dianthus/ and inhabited by moth/ fantastic bird/ and fantastic animal with face on abdomen/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 105r
folio_text: Christ: before Pilate -- Five men/ three wearing hats/ one with hat over shoulder/ watch or serve/ holding basin or cloth/ or pouring as Pilate/ wearing heat/ seated on throne/ washes his hands/ He looks toward man/ holding whip in left hand/ and beard of Christ with right hand/ Around his waist is girdle attached to rope binding crossed hands of Christ/ cross nimbed/ wearing crown of thorns/ bottom of His robe held by man standing behind with group of men/ most wearing hats/ one wearing hood/ some holding spears/ some bannered/ Scene in windowed room with niches and other architectural detail/ and tiled floor/ Visible through one window/ one man holds ax or adze over wood on ground/ and three others carry another piece of wood; through the other window/ in another room/ stand five men/ three wearing hats/ one wearing hood/ one holding object in raised in left hand/Miniature within arched frame/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ strawberry/ dianthus and columbine/ and inhabited by grasshopper/ snail/ and birds/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 112v
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross -- Christ/ with crown of thorns/ wearing long robe/ bearing cross on left shoulder/ left hand on crossbar/ right hand extended/ kneels on ground/ Beside Him/ dog runs; man before Him/ pulls rope around waist of Christ/ Beside Christ/ Simon of Cyrene holds upright of cross with both hands/ Behind Christ are: man/ wearing hat/ holding cloth over shoulder with right hand/ and walking stick/ with left hand; two horsemen/ one wearing hat and hood/ the other wearing pointed hood/ and carrying lance; group of men/ some wearing hats/ some carrying spears; and two women (?) one possibly wearing wimpled veil/ Walking ahead of Him is group of soldiers wearing armor and helmets and carrying spears/ surrounding two thieves/ their hands tied behind their backs/ Scene in landscape with hill/ on which two (?) figures possibly prepare hole for cross; city in background/Miniature within arched frame/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ rose and columbine/ and inhabited by snail/ birds/ and fantastic animals with faces on abdomens/ and one with nude man astride/ raising stick in left hand and holding reins in right hand/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 115v
folio_text: Christ: Presentation -- Next to draped altar/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ holds nude Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ before Simeon as High Priest/ nimbed/ wearing papal tiara/ hands extended/ They are amid group of men and women including/ Anna the Prophetess/ wearing hat/ holding/ with right hand/ basket containing two doves; three women/ nimbed and veiled/ Joseph the Carpenter (?) holding staff/ and nine men/ one resting hand on altar/ others raising hands/ All stand in room beneath baldachino/Miniature within arched frame/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and dianthus/ and inhabited by moth/ fantastic animal/ and hybrid man playing bagpipe/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 121r
folio_text: Christ: Crucifixion -- Christ/ rays as cross nimbus/ eyes possibly open/ wearing short loincloth/ is affixed with three nails to cross bearing titulus INRI/ His side is pierced by spear held by Longinus/ He is flanked above by sun and moon/ and by two thieves/ wearing short loincloths/ tied to tau crosses with arms over crossbars/ legs pierced/ bent backwards and tied/ At left are three Holy Women/ two nimbed/ one wearing headdress/ Evangelist John/ nimbed who possibly supports Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ Mary Magdalen/ wearing headdress kneels at foot of cross next to skull/ with joined hands raised/ At right are group of men wearing hats/ two horsemen wearing hats/ and soldiers wearing helmets/ In background are men/ and one horseman holding lance/ In distance is city/ All beneath starry sky/Miniature within arched gold frame/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by moth/ monkey playing small horn or holding flask to mouth/ and bird/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/
folio_text: Innocents: Massacre commanded and Innocents: Massacre -- Herod the Great/ crowned/ seated on canopied throne/ extends right hand toward three soldiers/ kneeling on one knee before him/ each wearing helmet and armor holding spear/ two wearing sheathed saber or sword/ Four men/ wearing hats/ three gesturing/ stand to right of Herod/ Visible through window are three soldiers with swords/ one grabbing mother with left hand and stabbing infant with right/ the other two raising swords at infant and at mother holding infant/ Third mother kneels on ground/ hands on breast/Miniature within arched gold frame/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and thistle/ and inhabited by peacock/ snail/ hybrid man wearing hat/ fox/ seated holding lantern in right front paw and broad ax over shoulder with left front paw and cock below/ crowing/ possibly/ Fable: Fox and Cock/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 133v
folio_text: Christ: Descent from Cross -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ bleeding from wounds/ is lowered from tau cross with titulus INRI/ by Nicodemus on ladder/ holding cross with left hand/ and right arm of Christ with right hand/ Next to ladder leaning on cross arm/ Joseph of Arimathea receives body of Christ with draped hands/ At left are Holy Woman (only top of head visible)/ nimbed and veiled/ Evangelist John/ nimbed/ and Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ kneeling/ with joined hands/ Skull and other bones on ground at base of cross/ City in background under starry sky/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and inhabited by fantastic animals/ birds/ one pecking ground/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 136v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Coronation -- Below two angels hovering/ holding crown/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneels with joined hands/ before God/ nimbed/ wearing triple crowned papal tiara/ raising right hand in blessing/ and holding on His lap/ cross-surmounted globe/ seated on throne/ In background/ behind bench with cushion/ are ranks of angels in red/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ and strawberry/ and inhabited by hybrid animal/ birds/ one pecking snail/ and fantastic animal/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 142v
folio_text: Christ: Entombment -- Body of Christ/ cross-nimbed/ bleeding from wounds/ wearing short loincloth/ lies on shroud held over sarcophagus by Joseph of Arimethea/ wearing hat/ at His head/ and Nicodemus/ wearing hat/ at His feet/ Behind sarcophagus/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ and wimpled/ kisses His right hand; she is flanked by Evangelist John/ nimbed/ and by two Holy Women/ nimbed and veiled/ Mary Magdalen/ nimbed/ holding cloth to face with right hand/ and jar in left hand/ kneels before sarcophagus/ Scene beneath vaulted baldachino/ with city on hill in background/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches and thistle/ and inhabited by birds/ moth and fantastic animal/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 180r
folio_text: Job: seated among Ashes -- Job/ wearing loin cloth with holes/ is seated on dung heap/ with joined hands/ To right stand of four men/ wearing hats/ and one women wearing headdress/ Some look toward Job; one averts eyes/ Scene with trees and crumbling building in background/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ columbine and inhabited by fly/ fantastic bird with head on tail/ moth/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 234r
folio_text: John Baptist: preaching -- Two men/ wearing hats/ woman wearing headdress/ and another man or woman/ are seated/ one looking up toward John Baptist/ nimbed/ wearing animal skin/ extending right hand/ holding on left hand/ Lamb of God/ nimbed/ holding with right front leg/ bannered cross-staff/ Scene in landscape with trees/ bushes/ and hills/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches and inhabited by birds/ fantastic animal/ and hybrid man wearing hat/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 235r
folio_text: Christopher of Lycia: carrying Christ Child -- Christ Child/ with rayed cross-nimbus/ raising right hand in blessing and holding cross-surmounted globe in left hand is seated on left shoulder of Christopher of Lycia/ holding long pole with both hands/ standing bare-legged in river/ On shore at left is hermet/ wearing hood/ holding lantern with both hands/ Scene in landscape with river/ hills/ church or hermitage on hill/ and city in background/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ strawberry/ rose/ and columbine/ and inhabited by birds/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 236v
folio_text: Sebastian of Rome: Scene/ Torture -- Sebastian/ nimbed/ wearing short loincloth/ in front of tree/ his arms behind tree/ his body pierced wit four arrows/ stands before two men/ wearing hats/ one with sheathed sword at waist/ aiming arrows at Sebastian/ Scene in landscape with trees/ river and buildings on hill in background/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns colonnettes and architectural elements/Initial O/ grisaille/ decorated with foliate ornament and inhabited by monkey/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ viola/ strawberry/ and rose/ and inhabited by snail/ birds/ fantastic animal with face on abdomen and on end of tail/ and dog with collar/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 238r
folio_text: Nicholas of Myra: Scene/ Three Youths rescued from Barrel -- Nicholas of Myra/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter with infulae/ vestments and gloves/ raising right hand in blessing and holding crozier in left hand/ stands before barrel in which are three youths/ tonsured/ nude/ one stepping out of barrel with left foot/ all with joined hands/ Scene in room with wooden ceiling/ entablature with pseudo-inscription/ and colonnade at window; city on hilltop in background/Miniature below polylobe arch supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ strawberry and rose/ and inhabited by birds and fantastic animal/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 239r
folio_text: Claudius of Besan³´on/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter with infulae/ vestments and gloves/ raising right hand in blessing/ and holding cross staff in left hand/ stands before drapery in windowed room with tile floor/Miniature within arched frame supported by columns colonnettes and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ rose and viola/ and inhabited by birds/ fantastic animal with face on abdomen/ hybrid animal with single horn on head/ snail/ and monkey/ holding reins/ astride hybrid animal/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 241r
folio_text: Mary Magdalen/ nimbed and veiled/ holding open book with right hand and ointment jar with left hand/ stands before rocky outcrop with river and city in background/Miniature within polylobe arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ columbine/ and rose/ and inhabited by birds and snail/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ perhaps Langres/ ca/ 1485-1490MS M/26 fol/ 242v
folio_text: Flanked by pieces of broken wheel on ground/ Catherine of Alexandria/ nimbed and crowned/ holding sword with right hand and open book in left hand/ stands in landscape with bushes/ river and city on hill in background/Miniature within trilobe arched frame supported by columns and architectural elements/Margins decorated with floreate and foliate ornament/ including large branches/ thistle/ dianthus/ rose/ and strawberry/ and inhabited by monkey raising stick in left paw/ and holding reins in right/ astride hybrid animal with face on abdomen/ snail and monkey/ possibly wearing collar/ doing handstand/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 2r
folio_text: Easter Table within frame/ Decorated initials above columns/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 2v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: January -- Two-faced Janus/ wearing hat/ lifting cup with right hand to right face and food with left hand to left face/ stands behind draped table on which are two plates with food/ two loaves/ covered cup/ and container/ Servant stands at left end of table holding pitcher/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 3r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Aquarius -- Nude man/ kneeling on one knee/ holding vase in each hand/ pouring water onto ground/ Floreate ornament around medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 3v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: February -- Man wearing hat and hood sitting on chair raising left hand and holding bare left foot toward fire in fireplace/ Cooking pot hanging over fire/ Scene in room with wood-beamed ceiling/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 4r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Pisces -- Two fish/ facing opposite directions/ connected by cord/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 4v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: March -- Man digging with mattock/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 5r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Aries -- Ram/ badly rubbed/ Foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 5v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: April -- Man/ wearing chaperon with gorget/ carrying limb or small tree over right shoulder/ with purse on girdle/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 6r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Taurus -- Bull/ Foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 6v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: May -- Man/ wearing chaperon with short gorget/ on horseback/ holding reins with right hand/ falcon resting on raised left hand/ sheathed sword at waist and spurs on feet/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 7r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Gemini -- Two men/ nude/ embracing behind shield/Foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 7v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: June -- Man/ wearing broad brimmed hat/ his hose rolled down to knees/ mowing with scythe/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 8r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Cancer -- Lobster/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 8v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: July -- Man/ wearing broad brimmed hat/ harvesting grain with sickle/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin containing scroll inscribed G/O/B/Y/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 9r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Leo -- Lion/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 9v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: August -- Man/ with hose rolled down to knees/ beating flax with flail/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 10r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Virgo -- Woman/ extending right hand over sheaf of wheat and holding palm in left hand; another sheaf of wheat on ground behind her/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 10v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: September -- Man wearing broad brimmed hat/ crushing grapes in vat as another man empties basket of grapes into vat/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 11r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Libra -- Woman holding scales in right hand and raising left hand/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 11v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: October -- Man/ wearing hat/ hose rolled down to knees/ sewing seed with right hand from tunic held up by left hand/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 12r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Scorpio -- Scorpion/ Foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 12v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: November -- Next to two pigs/ man/ wearing hat and hood/ holding stick with both hands/ knocking acorns from trees to ground/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 13r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Sagittarius -- Centaur/ back-turned/ shooting with bow and arrow/ Floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 13v
folio_text: Month/ Occupation: December -- Man/ wearing hat and apron/ with one knee on back of pig holding snout with left hand and cutting throat with knife in right hand/ Woman/ wearing short veil/ catching blood of pig in basin/Ornament of rinceaux in left margin and floreate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 14r
folio_text: Zodiac Sign: Capricornus -- Goat/ Foliate ornament surrounding medallion/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 15r
folio_text: John Baptist: Birth and John Baptist: Naming -- Elizabeth/ nimbed/ reclines in draped/ canopied/ bed/ Next to bed stand midwife/ holding infant John Baptist/ nimbed and swaddled; man wearing hat raising right hand; Zacharias/ wearing hood/ leaning on bed and writing with stylus on tablet; third man looking on/Initial on gold background/ Ornament of rinceaux in margins/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 17r
folio_text: Cross/ in right margin/ decorated with instruments of Passion including three nails/ from which runs blood/ crown of thorns/ and flail/Decorated initial P on gold background/ Ornament of rinceaux in margins/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 18v
folio_text: In lower margin/ Evangelist John/ nimbed/ holding with draped right hand/ cup containing snakes/ and with left hand/ palm/ Evangelist symbol (eagle)/ nimbed stands next to him holding in its beak scroll inscribed S/IOHANNEM/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 19r
folio_text: In lower margin/ Evangelist symbol (ox)/ nimbed/ holding in mouth/ scroll inscribed S LUCAM/ sits on ground next to Evangelist Luke/ nimbed/ holding open book with both hands/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 20r
folio_text: In lower margin/ Evangelist Matthew/ nimbed/ raising right hand/ holding object in left hand/ Evangelist symbol (angel)/ nimbed/ with scroll/ Figures rubbed/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 21r
folio_text: In lower margin/ next to scroll inscribed S/MARCUM/ Evangelist Mark/ nimbed/ holding pen (?) in left hand/ stands beside evangelist symbol (lion)/ nimbed and winged/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 21v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Archangel Gabriel/ nimbed/ right hand raised/ holding in left hand scroll inscribed AVE GRACIA PLENA/ kneeling on one knee facing Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ hands crossed on breast/ kneeling in front of throne with cushion/ Prie-dieu/ draped/ on top of which is book/ is to her right/ Touching her nimbus/ is dove of Holy Ghost flying on rays emitted by head of God (?) in cloud above roof/ Figures in vaulted room/Ornament of rinceaux in margins/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 29r
folio_text: In initial D/ Apostle Peter/ nimbed/ wearing papal tiara/ holding keys in right hand and open book in left hand/In initial D/ Apostle Paul/ nimbed/ holding book in right hand and sword with left/In initial M/ Apostle Andrew/ nimbed/ grasping saltire cross with right hand and holding book with left hand/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 29v
folio_text: In initial D/ Apostle James Major/ nimbed/ wearing pilgrim's hat/ holding open book with both hands/ supporting staff behind right arm/ flanked by two trees/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 30r
folio_text: In initial Q/ flanked by two trees/ Apostle Bartholomew/ nimbed/ holding knife in right hand and open book with left hand/In initial D/ Apostle Thomas/ nimbed/ holding book with right hand and spear (?) with left hand/In initial D/ Apostles Philip/ nimbed/ holding horn (?) and James/ nimbed/ indicating with right hand cross or cross-staff held with left hand/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 30v
folio_text: 1) In initial D/ Apostles Simon and Jude/ nimbed/ one holding book with draped right hand and raised sword in left hand; the other holding sword with left hand/2) In initial D/ Apostle Matthias/ nimbed/ holding open book with right hand and hatchet or axe with left hand/Initials on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 31r
folio_text: In initial D/ Apostle Barnabas/ nimbed/ holding open book with both hands/ standing next to fire/In initial S are Apostles Peter/ holding key in right hand and book in left hand/ possibly Paul/ holding sword with left hand/ and Andrew holding saltire cross/ All are nimbed/ Behind them are other Apostles/ partially visible/ including on holding palm/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 31v
folio_text: Christ: Nativity -- Joseph the Carpenter/ nimbed/ wearing pouch at waist/ holding object in right hand and walking stick with left hand stands behind Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ with joined hands/ She kneels at foot of manger in which is infant Christ/ nimbed/ swaddled/ flanked by ox and ass/ All are within shed with broken wall and hole in roof/Gold bar with geometric and floral ornament in center margin; floreate and rinceaux ornament in upper and lower margins/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 39v
folio_text: Pentecost -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ with joined hands/ is seated on throne and flanked by 16 (?) apostles/ nimbed/ four with joined hands/ and one with open book on his lap/ Above her/ dove of Holy Ghost/ nimbed/ descends amid rays/ Scene in windowed room with tiled floor/In left margin/ heraldic shield of Garin of Rouen (gules/ two cockle-shells or in chief/ and a heart argent in point)/ bar inscribed with motto G/O/B/Y/ Decoration of floreate and rinceaux ornament in margins/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 40v
folio_text: Catherine of Alexandria: Scene/ with Philosophers -- Catherine/ nimbed and crowned (?)/ hands raised/ wearing mantle lined with vair/ is seated on faldstool before seven philosophers/ six wearing caps/ three with right hand raised/ four behind long lectern on which is book/ Scene in windowed room/Margins decorated with floreate ornament and rinceaux/ and bars decorated with geometric ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 46r
folio_text: Christ: Baptism -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ with joined hands/ wearing short loincloth/ stands in river/At left is angel/ nimbed/ with red wings/ garment draped over his arms/ At right is John Baptist/ nimbed/ holding bowl over head of Christ with right hand/ and book with left hand/ Above Him/ bust of God/ cross nimbed/ raising right hand in blessing/ holding globe with left hand is in arc of heaven emitting rays/ Dove of Holy Ghost/ nimbed/ hovers above Christ/ Scroll extending from God to Christ is inscribed HIC EST FILIUS MEUS IN EO MIHI BENE CUMPLA[CUI]/ Scene in landscape with trees and with city on hills in background/Decoration of floreate ornament and rinceaux in margins/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 46v
folio_text: Catherine of Alexandria: Scene/ Martyrdom -- Catherine/ nimbed and crowned/ with joined hands raised/ is beside two spiked wheels on frame/ Several bodies recline on ground beside the wheels/ and stones (?) fall from cloud above/ Maxentius/ crowned/ right hand raised/ holding sword raised in left hand/ wearing vair lined mantle/ is seated in background with another figure/ Scene below starry sky in landscape with hills/ and city in distance/Decoration of floreate ornament and rinceaux in margins/ Heraldic shield of Garin (gules/ two cockle-shells or in chief/ and a heart argent in point) in lower margin/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 47v
folio_text: David: communicating with God -- David/ with joined hands raised/ wearing purse at waist/ kneels on one knee looking up toward bust of God/ cross-nimbed/ raising right hand in blessing/ holding cross-surmounted globe with left hand in arc of heaven emitting rays/ Harp on ground next to David/ Scene in hilly landscape with trees/ and with city in distance/Decoration of floreate ornament and rinceaux in margins/ In initial D/ heraldic shield of Garin (gules/ two cockle-shells or in chief/ and a heart argent in point)/ In bar in center margin/ motto G/O/B/Y/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 75r
folio_text: Dove of Holy Ghost/ hovering/ is flanked by Christ/ holding cross in left hand and God/ raising right hand in blessing/ both touching open book on their laps/ They are seated amid rays on bench with cushion/ All have cross-nimbus/Initial on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 76r
folio_text: Scene/ Liturgical: Obsequies -- Two or three mourners/ wearing hoods/ stand opposite four (?) clerics standing at draped lectern on which is open book/ In foreground is bier draped with cross-inscribed pall with candle at each corner/Initial on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 77v
folio_text: In initial D/ Apostle Peter/ holding book with right hand and key with left hand/ Apostle Paul/ gesturing with right hand/ holding sword with left hand/ and cleric/ tonsured/ wearing deacon's vestments/ holding object/ stand in front of group of other saints/ partially visible; all are nimbed/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 78v
folio_text: Scene/ Liturgical: Celebration of Mass -- In initial D/ Priest/ tonsured/ wearing vestments/ elevates host before draped altar on which is open book/ draped chalice/ and candlestick/ Behind priest kneels acolyte/ raising chasuable with left hand and holding candle with right hand/ Next to him are seven men/ kneeling/ two with joined hands raised/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 80r
folio_text: In initial D/ in mandorla emitting rays/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed and crowned/ stands holding Christ Child/ cross nimbed/ on her draped left arm/ He touches her face with His left hand/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 82v
folio_text: Christ: in Gethsemane -- Christ/ nimbed/ with joined hands raised/ kneels looking toward bust of God/ nimbed/ right hand raised in blessing/ in arc of heaven emitting rays/ Angel/ nimbed/ holding cross/ emerges from cloud above Christ/ In foreground three apostles/ nimbed/ sleep/ Scene in garden with small trees/ surrounded by wattle fence/Decorated initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rectilinear bars terminating in ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 85r
folio_text: Christ: Betrayal and Arrest and Apostle/ Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- In initial D/ Peter/ nimbed/ returning sword to sheath/ is standing above Malchus/ wearing hat/ holding lantern in left hand/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ touches Malchus with His right hand/ as Judas kisses His cheek/ Soldiers/ wearing helmets/ some holding spears/ one with sheathed sword/ and shield stand behind Judas/ All within garden with wattle fence/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 87r
folio_text: Christ: before Pilate -- In initial D/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ hands crossed and bound/ is surrounded by three soldiers/ one holding end of rope binding His hands/ All stand before Pilate/ wearing hat/ with purse at his waist/ seated/ indicating Christ with left hand/ Another man/ wearing hat and with sheathed saber at waist/ kneels on one knee beside Christ/ looking up toward Pilate/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 88r
folio_text: Christ: Flagellation -- In initial D/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing short loincloth/ stands behind column/ hands bound in front/ His body covered with wounds/ He is flanked by two torturers/ one holding scourge/ the other holding withes/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 89r
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross -- In initial D/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ carries tau cross over left shoulder/ holding cross-arm with both hands/ Behind Him are Simon of Cyrene/ holding upright of cross with both hands; Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled with joined hands; Holy Woman/ nimbed/ with joined hands; and man wearing hat/ Beside Him/ is man/ wearing hat/ holding hammer/ Soldier wearing helmet/ with sheathed saber at his waist/ extending left hand to hold rope around His waist/ stands facing Christ/ Soldiers/ wearing helmets/ some carrying spears are in background/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 90r
folio_text: Christ: Crucifixion/ nailed to Cross -- In initial D/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing short loincloth/ lies on cross on grass/ His arms already affixed/ One of two soldiers holds His feet; the other/ wearing sword at waist/ holds nail with left hand and raises hammer with right hand/ A third figure/ recumbent/ only partially visible/ with right foot braced on stake in ground next to cross/ holds rope with both hands that possibly pulls down feet of Chrit/ At left is man holding rod in raised right hand/ and soldiers/ wearing helmets/ some holding spear (?)/ At right are Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ with joined hands/ kneeling/ next to two other nimbed figures/ only partially visible/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 91r
folio_text: Christ: Deposition -- In initial D/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ with crown of thorns/ wearing short loincloth/ bleeds from wounds/ Nicodemus/ standing on ladder behind cross arm/ removes nail from His right hand/ At right/ Joseph of Arimethea stands on ladder with his left arm around body of Christ/ On ground at left are Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ with joined hands raised/ and Evangelist John/ his left hand at Christ's waist and his right hand on His right leg/ Behind them are other nimbed figures/ only nimbi visible/ Scene on grassy hillside/ with bones on ground/ below starry sky/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 92v
folio_text: Christ: Entombment -- In initial C/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing short loincloth/ is recumbent on cloth atop sarcophagus/ His head supported by Evangelist John/ nimbed/ Joseph of Arimethea/ wearing hat/ possibly touches His left arm/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ with her left hand/ holds and kisses His left hand/ Nicodemus touches His right leg/ holding jar with left hand/ Behind them are Holy Woman/ nimbed and veiled/ with joined hands/ and other nimbed figures/ only nimbi visible/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 137v
folio_text: Jerome/ nimbed/ wearing cardinal's hat/ is seated on chair at desk on which is open book in which he writes with right hand/ Next to book are ink pot and stylus case/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/ Head/ wearing hat/ drawn on upright of initial D at top of left column/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 156r
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Infancy/ Instruction -- In initial D/ young Virgin Mary/ nimbed and crowned/ indicates text in open book on lap of Anna/ nimbed and wearing wimpled veil/ seated on bench/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 156v
folio_text: In initial L/ Mary Magdalen/ nimbed and veiled/ holding book in right hand and covered ointment jar with left hand/ standing in landscape flanked by two trees/In initial D/ Catherine of Alexandria/ nimbed and crowned/ holding open book with right hand and sword and palm in left hand stands next to wheel/Initials on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 157r
folio_text: Apollonia of Alexandria: Scene/ Torture -- In initial D/ Apollonia/ nimbed/ stands in front of column/ her hands behind her as torturer holds pincers at her mouth/Initial on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 157v
folio_text: Margaret of Antioch: Scene/ emerging from Dragon -- In initial O/ Margaret/ nimbed/ with joined hands raised and holding cross/ emerges from back of winged dragon; fabric of her cloak dangles from mouth of dragon/Genevieve of Paris: Scene/ Candle lighted by Angel -- In initial P/ Genevieve/ nimbed/ stands holding open book in right hand and candle with left hand/ She is flanked by angel lighting the candle and by winged devil with bellows aimed at the candle/Initials on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 158r
folio_text: Avia of Sicily: Scene/ in Prison -- In initial B/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed and crowned/ stands at barred window of prison/ extending vessel with both hands toward Avia/ nimbed/ with joined hands/ standing behind bars/In initial D/ Austreberta of Th³brouanne/ nimbed/ wearing habit of nun/ stands holding book with right hand/ and staff or walking stick with left hand/In initial E/ Radegundis of Poitiers/ nimbed/ wearing habit of nun/ stands holding book with left hand/Initials on gold background and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 158v
folio_text: In initial P/ Quiteria of Galicia/ nimbed/ holding book in left hand/ stands with dog at her feet/In initial D/ Columba of Sens/ nimbed/ stands holding book in right hand and palm in left/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 159r
folio_text: In initial E/ Honorina of Normandy/ nimbed/ stands holding palm with right hand and open book in left hand/In initial D/ Veronica of Rome/ nimbed/ veiled/ possibly wimpled/ stands holding sudarium on which is image of head of Christ/ no nimbus/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 159v
folio_text: In initial D/ three female saints/ nimbed/ each holding palm with right hand and book with left hand or under left arm stand at front of group of saints/ only nimbi visible/In initial O/ John Baptist/ nimbed/ stands/ his right hand indicating lamb/ nimbed/ resting on his draped left arm/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 160r
folio_text: In initial O/ Stephen Protomartyr/ nimbed and tonsured/ wearing deacon's vestments/ kneels/ with joined hands holding palm/ Behind him torturer raises right hand holding stone and with left hand holds tunic as pouch full of stones/In initial D/ Clement of Rome/ nimbed/ wearing papal tiara with infulae/ raises right hand in blessing/ and with left hand/ holds anchor/ attached to rope around his neck/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 160v
folio_text: In initial A/ Vincent of Saragossa/ nimbed and tonsured/ wearing deacon's vestments/ stands holding book with right hand and palm with left hand/In initial D/ Lawrence of Rome/ nimbed and tonsured/ is recumbent on grill over fire/ with his hands joined/ wearing loincloth/ and his feet tied or shackled together/ Torturer stands at side of grill with bellows; Decius/ crowned/ holding upturned sword with right hand/ and another figure/ look through window in background/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 161r
folio_text: In initial D/ Denis of Paris/ nimbed/ wearing vestments/ holds/ head wearing miter with both hands/In initial P/ Christopher of Lycia/ leaning on walking stick held in right hand/ holding cloak with left hand walks through water/ He looks back toward his left shoulder on which is Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ raising right hand in blessing/ holding globe with left hand/ On far shore/ hermit/ holding lantern/ emerges from opening in building/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 161v
folio_text: George of Cappadocia: slaying Dragon -- In initial D/ George/ nimbed/ wearing armor/ with tunic inscribed with red cross/ is astride bridled horse/ whose front hooves stand on tail of dragon/ George stabs dragon on ground with lance held with both hands/ Princess of Trebizond/ wearing headdress/ with joined hands/ kneels behind him/Nicasius of Reims: Scene/ carrying Head -- In initial I/ Nicasius of Reims/ nimbed/ bleeding from top of head/ wearing bishop's vestments/ carries crown of his head/ indicating tonsure with left hand/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 162r
folio_text: Within initial O/ Clarus of Vexin stands holding head/ nimbed and tonsured/ in front of his chest with both hands/ Nimbus also above shoulders/Within initial D/ two torturers/ with bows and arrows aim toward Sebastian/ nimbed/ his hands tied back around tree/ his body full of arrows/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 162v
folio_text: Eustace of Rome: Scene/ Sons seized by Beasts -- In initial D/ Eustace of Rome/ nimbed/ orant/ stands in river/ On bank behind Eustace/ one son is carried off by lion and before him on bank in foreground/ the other son is carried off by wolf/Cosmos and Damian of Cilicia: Scene/ doctoring -- In initial P/ both Cosmos and Damian are nimbed/ One holds instrument to bleeding head wound of man/ with joined hands/ and the other holds covered jar with both hands/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 163r
folio_text: In initial C/ Eutropius of Saintes/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter and vestments/ holding processional cross with right hand/ looks at open book held with left hand/Innocents: Massacre -- In initial D/ soldier/ wearing helmet and armor/ holding sword in right hand and right arm of infant in left hand/ stabs the infant held by mother/ veiled and wimpled/ Two other infants on ground bleed from wounds/ Scene in landscape with tree/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 163v
folio_text: In initial D/ Laudus of Coutances/ nimbed and wearing bishop's miter/ raises right hand in blessing/ and holds crozier with left hand/In initial D/ winged dragon stands next to Romanus of Rouen/ nimbed and wearing bishop's miter and vestments/ raising his right hand in blessing and holding processional cross with left hand/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 164r
folio_text: In initial D/ Martin of Tours/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter and vestments/ stands raising right hand in blessing and holding cross-staff with left hand/Nicholas of Myra: Scene/ aiding Dowerless Maidens -- In initial D/ man wearing cap reclines in bed/ his head resting on pillow/ At window/ stand three women/ one with arms extended; outside of window/ Nicholas of Myra/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter/ extends right hand holding sack through window/ and holds crozier with left hand/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Rouen/ ca/ 1420-1430MS M/27 fol/ 164v
folio_text: In initial D/ Audoenus of Rouen/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter and vestments/ raises right hand in blessing and holds cross-staff with left hand/In initial A/ Augustine of Hippo/ nimbed/ wearing miter/ is seated on chair with lectern on which is open book; weight (?) on cord hangs over top of lectern/ Crozier stands next to lectern at left/Initials on gold backgrounds and decorated with ornament of rinceaux/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 1r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man/ wearing hat/ seated on bench before fire in fireplace/ Behind him is draped trestle table/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 1v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is male figure pouring water from jug (Aquarius)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 2r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man standing and drinking from vessel/Margins with foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 2v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin are two fish (Pisces)/Margins with foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 3r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man/ wearing hat/ pruning bare vines with pruning hook/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 3v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is sheep grazing (Aries)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 4r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man/ wearing hat/ holding plant or branch in each hand/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 4v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is bull (Taurus)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 5r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man with hawk/ with wings extended/ perched on his left wrist/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 5v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin are two androgynous nude figures/ standing/ joining hands (Gemini)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 6r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man/ wearing hat/ carrying sheep over his shoulders/ Background with gold scroll design/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 6v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is lobster (Cancer)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 7r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man mowing field with scythe/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 7v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is seated lion (Leo)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 8r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man cutting grain with sickle/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 8v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is woman holding plant in right hand and sheaf of grain in left hand (Virgo)/ Background decorated with gold scroll design/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 9r
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is man/ wearing apron gathered in left hand/ sowing seeds with right hand/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 9v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is balance scale (Libra)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 10r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man trampling grapes in vat/Margins with foliate ornament including thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 10v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is scorpion (Scorpio)/Margins with foliate ornament including thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 11r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man holding axe over left shoulder in both hands/ beside pig/ laying on ground/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 11v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is centaur aiming bow and arrow (Sagittarius)/ Background with gold scroll design/Margins with foliate ornament including violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 12r
folio_text: In medallion in right margin is man/ wearing hat/ with towel at waist/ removing loaves from oven with baker's peel/ Behind him is trestle table with two loaves/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 12v
folio_text: In medallion in left margin is goat (Capricornus)/Margins with foliate ornament including violas and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 13r
folio_text: Evangelist/ John: Scene/ on Patmos -- Eagle/ nimbed/ holding inkpot and stylus case in beak/ stands beside Evangelist John/ nimbed/ seated/ writing with pen held in right hand on scroll with pseudo-inscription/ both on island/ In background is landscape with sea/ ships/ swan/ cities/ and mountains/ with sun emanating rays above/Amid foliate ornament in margins are birds; nude angel/ kneeling on one knee/ playing pipe; nude woman/ kneeling on one knee in fishing net/ playing harp; monkey/ squatting down/ holding his buttocks with his hands and defecating; and two standing monkeys/ holding ropes of net in which is third monkey/ bending over/ with right hand on rope and left hand behind left leg/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 14v
folio_text: Evangelist Luke/ nimbed/ holding pen and knife/ sits on faldstool before desk with open book with pseudo inscription/ Before the desk lays winged ox/ nimbed/ Rays enter through doorway toward Luke/ Scene in room with wooden ceiling/ arched window with tracery/ patterned curtain/ carved figures/ and tiled floor/Amid foliate ornament in margins are human-lion hybrid wearing pointed hood/ holding string (?) between his paws; man/ wearing hat/ holding scroll with pseudo inscription; hybrid man with human-faced shield; angel/ nimbed/ embracing foliage; and merman/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 15v
folio_text: Amid foliate ornament in margins are archer/ standing and aiming bow held in right hand; guinea fowl with wings extended; hybrid man/ wearing hood/ with human-faced shield on right arm; hybrid man/ wearing hat/ with spear in raised left hand and human-faced shield on right arm; wivern; and figure/ wearing hat/ possibly wild man or scarecrow/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 16r
folio_text: Evangelist Matthew/ with scalloped nimbus/ wearing cap/ writing with pen on open book with pseudo-inscription/ sits on faldstool/ Beside him stands man/ with scalloped nimbus (Evangelist symbol)/ before patterned wall hanging/Amid foliate ornament in margins are fox-faced hybrid with bat wings; birds; hooded man playing bagpipe; swan with wings extended; and cat/ licking its back/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 17v
folio_text: Evangelist Mark/ with scalloped nimbus/ sits in architectural niche on chair behind writing desk from which extends scroll with pseudo inscription/ Winged lion/ nimbed/ lays beside writing desk/ In background/ man ascends spiral staircase/ Scene in room with carved canopy supported by thin columns/ statues/ and arches/Amid foliate ornament in margins are male hybrid with staff and human-faced shield; swan; hybrid man aiming bow and arrow; and mermaid/ holding rod/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 18v
folio_text: Amid foliate ornament in margins are man/ squatting down/ hands on his face/ making a face (?); red-legged crane; hybrid man/ wearing hood/ seated/ with right paw pulling flower toward his nose; wild man/ holding club in both hands; nude man/ playing bagpipe; peacock/ with tail fanned out; and angel/ holding blank shield or tablet/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 19r
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross/ and Simon of Cyrene: bearing Cross -- Nimbed man and woman/ probably Virgin Mary and Evangelist John/ follow along rock-strewn road Christ/ with decorated nimbus/ wearing crown of thorns/ carrying cross with the assistance of Simon of Cyrene/ wearing hat/ Hooded man pulls Christ toward right with rope around His waist/ In background is city of Jerusalem/ behind moat or river with boats/Amid foliate ornament in margins are six nimbed angels/ including three kneeling with joined hands raised/ two with arms around knees/ and one with arms crossed on breast; and two birds/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 20v
folio_text: Amid foliate ornament in margins are hybrid man/ wearing hat and coat/ with staff in right hand and holding horn to his mouth with left hand; rabbit; dog; bear/ seated/ licking its right front paw; snail; peacock with fanned tail; and griffin/ laying down/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 21r
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneeling at prie-dieu/ holding page of open book with pseudo-inscription with right hand/ raises left hand and looks toward Angel Gabriel/ nimbed/ holding scroll inscribed AVE MARIA GRATIA PLENA DOMINUS in left hand and with right hand pointing up toward dove of Holy Ghost/ descending on rays toward Virgin Mary/ Scene in hexagonal building with rib vaults/ leaded-glass windows/ pinnacled arches/ columns with carved figures/ and tiled floor/In initial D/ two angels flank and support escutcheon with arms (azure a chevron or) largely obliterated/Amid foliate ornament in margins are hybrid woman with spiral shell/ wearing headdress/ holding bladder pipe to her mouth with both hands; monkey/ seated in net; hybrid animal/ wearing bells around neck/ playing pipe and tabor/ with human face on its hindquarters; moths and birds/ including stork; pig playing bagpipe; man/ possibly nude below waist/ kneeling and holding sash between his hands; hybrid woman/ winged/ playing rebec; and peacock/ with fanned tail/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 22v
folio_text: Amid foliate ornament in margins are bearded human-headed hybrid/ wearing cowl; bird; partially draped nude man/ winged/ with pointy ears; hooded man/ with human-faced shield in right hand/ kneeling; and blackbird/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 23r
folio_text: Amid foliate ornament in margins are winged man/ wearing headgear/ holding club with both hands; owl; and hybrid bird/ possibly owl with human face/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ ca/ 1470MS M/28 fol/ 24r
