folio_text: Pentecost -- Of five apostles/ nimbed/ one has hands raised/ They kneel outside room in which dove of Holy Ghost/ surrounded by rays/ hovers above Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ kneeling with joined hands raised/ surrounded by seven Apostles/ nimbed/ one with right hand raised and two with joined hands raised/Illusionistic border is inhabited by birds/ In the lower border/ peacock stands on stem of strawberry plant/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 43v
folio_text: Holy Ghost -- Dove of Holy Ghost/ amid rays/ has wings outstreched/ within clouds/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 45v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Archangel Gabriel/ holds scepter in left hand and extends right hand toward Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ seated/ raising left hand and with right holding open book in lap/ She sits beside draped table/ upon which is open book/ Above/ dove of Holy Ghost descends on rays/ toward the Virgin/ Scene in room with lancet windows and arcade/In illusionistic border are birds/ snail/ iris/ roses/ thistles/ and strawberries/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 46r
folio_text: Virgin Mary and Christ Child: Type/ Foetus -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ rayed foetus in abdomen/ kneels (?) with joined hands raised/ Rays from sky extend toward foetus/ Virgin is flanked by David/ with harp in left hand/ raising right hand/ and by male figure/ wearing hat/ right hand raised/ and palm branch (?) in left hand/In illusionistic border are flowers/ including lily/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 72v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Visitation -- Joseph the Carpenter/ holds hat and walking stick in left hand/ He stands behind Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ hands extended toward Elizabeth/ nimbed and veiled/ left hand extended/ Scene in landscape setting with building/In illusionistic border are birds/ flies/ moth/ and flowers/ including roses/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 88v
folio_text: Christ: Nativity -- Joseph the Carpenter/ with purse at waist/ rasies right hand and holds lamp in left hand/ He stands behind Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneeling with joined hands raised before nude Chirst Child/ emitting rays/ on ground beside trough/ In background is shed beneath which are ox and ass/ Rays shine through hole in roof/ In sky is angel amid clouds/In illusionistic border are moth and flowers/ including roses and thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 95v
folio_text: Shepherds: Annunciation -- Angel in sky amid clouds extends hands toward two shepherds/ one kneeling on one knee with right hand raised and other kneeling with hands raised/ On ground beside them is sheep/ pedum/ and hat/ Scene in landscape setting with flock/ barn/ and other buildings/In illusionistic border are sheep and flowers/ including thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 96r
folio_text: Within decorated initial D is head of man/ wearing helmet/In illusionistic border are flowers/ strawberries/ peapod/ moth/ and bird/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 102v
folio_text: Magi: Adoration -- Of two Magi holding vessels in right hands/ one wears crown and other holds crown in left hand/ They stand behind eldest Magus/ with crown on ground beside him/ holding vessel in right hand and extending left hand toward nude Christ Child/ rays as nimbus/ seated in lap of Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ Scene in front of shed/ Star of Bethlehem in sky/ emitting rays/ Landscape in background/In illusionistic border are bird/ moth/ strawberries/ and flowers/ including roses and thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 109v
folio_text: Christ: Presentation -- Prophetess Anna/ wearing headdress/ holds candle in left hand and basket with doves (?)/ Behind her is Joseph the Carpenter/ and Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ with left hand raised and with right hand holding nude Christ Child/ rays as nimbus/ At right/ behind draped altar are two men/ wearing hats/ one with hands raised/ Knife on the altar (for circumcision)/ Scene in vaulted room with choir screen and canopy/In illusionistic border are fly and flowers/ including thistles and columbines/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 110r
folio_text: Within decorated initial D is peacock/In illusionistic border are moth and flowers/ including thistles and daisies

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 116v
folio_text: Christ: Flight into Egypt -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ holds swaddled Christ Child/ rays as nimbus/ and sits sideways on bridled ass led by Joseph the Carpenter/ carrying staff on shoulder/ Scene in landscape setting with rocks and buildings in background/Christ: Flight into Egypt/ Miracle of Cornfield -- In illusionistic border are soldier/ mounted and carrying lances/ In foreground is man/ holding pruning knife in right hand/ reaping grain/ In lower and right border are flowers/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 117r
folio_text: Within decorated initial D is head of woman/ wearing headdress/In illusionistic border are flowers/ including daisies/ strawberries/ and bird/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 128v
folio_text: Innocents: Massacre -- Man extends hands toward mother/ veiled/ kneeling on one knee/ hands extended toward man/ raising sword in left hand to strike nude infant that he holds by right arm/In background is Herod/ wearing hat/ seated on throne beneath canopy/ with scepter in right hand and left hand raised/ Scene in room with portal/In illusionistic border are thistles/ moth/ and bird/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 135v
folio_text: Virgin Mary and Christ Child -- Abbot/ nimbed/ tonsured/ holds crozier in crook of right arm and raises left hand/ He stands beside Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ holding her exposed right breast/ which emits milk/ In her left hand she holds nude Christ Child/ with hands raised/ Scene in room with canopy and open window/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 138r
folio_text: Virgin Mary and Christ Child: Type/ Suckling -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ is suckling Christ Child/ rays as nimbus/ Scene in room with curtain and two windows open onto landscape setting/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 143v
folio_text: Virgin Mary and Christ Child: Apocalyptic Woman -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ holds with both hands nude Christ Child/ rays as nimbus/ She emits rays/ stands upon crescent moon/and is surrounded by clouds/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 150v
folio_text: David: in Prayer -- David/ kneeling on one knee/ with crown around right arm and raises hands toward angel/ holding three arrows in left hand/ On ground is harp-shaped sack and scepter/ Scene in landscape setting with bridge and buildings in background/In illusionistic border are three groups of three arrows and flowers/ including thistles and violas/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 151r
folio_text: David: beheading Goliath -- David raises sword in right hand and touches with left hand head of Goliath/ fallen on ground/ with right hand raised/ supporting himself with left hand/ Scene in decorated initial D/In illusionistic border are two groups of three arrows/ a crown/ scepter/ harp/ and flowers/ including roses/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 180v
folio_text: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Woman/ wearing headdress/ and man/ wearing hat/ stand behind man/ wearing hat/ extending hand toward Lazarus/ nude/ partially draped/ standing in grave with joined hands raised/ He looks toward Christ/ rays as nimbus/ with right hand raised in blessing and left hand extended/Scene in walled yard in front of church and open portal/In illusionistic border are skull/ bones/ fly/ and flowers/ including violas and thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 181r
folio_text: Personification: Death -- Skeleton/ as half figure/ holds arrow in raised right hand and mirror from chain in left hand/ Figure in decorated inital D/In illusionistic border are skull and flowers/ including violas and thistles/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 248v
folio_text: Martin of Tours: dividing Cloak -- Man/ with crutch under right arm/ raises left hand toward Martin of Tours/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ astride horse/ holding in left hand sword with which he divides cloak/ Scene in landscape setting with buildings in background/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 249v
folio_text: Nicholas of Myra: Scene/ Three Youths rescued from Barrel -- Three nude youths/ tonsured/ two with joined hands raised/ stand in barrel and look toward Nicholas of Myra/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter/ making gesture of blessing with right hand and holding crozier in left hand/ Scene in room with curtain and two windows open onto landscape setting/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 250v
folio_text: Anthony Abbot/ nimbed/ wearing cap/ sits holding open book on lap and staff in left hand/ He is beside pig in landscape setting with buildings/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 251v
folio_text: Apostle James Major/ nimbed/ wearing hat with pilgrim's shell/ holds staff in right hand and open book in left hand/ Figure stands in landscape setting/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 252v
folio_text: Christopher of Lycia: carrying Christ Child -- Christopher of Lycia/ nimbed/ stands in river/ holding staff in both hands/ On his shoulders is Christ-Child/ rays as nimbus/ raising right hand in blessing and holding cross-surmounted globe in left hand/ On right bank of river is hermit/ extending lantern held in right hand/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 253v
folio_text: Adrian of Nicomedia/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ holds sword in right hand and book in left hand/ Beside him is lion/ seated on ground/ Figure in landscape setting with buildings in background/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 255r
folio_text: Julian Hospitaler/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ holds open book in right hand and sword in left hand/ He stands upon half figure of man/ wearing hat/ holding staff (?) in right hand/ Scene in landscape setting with buildings in background/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 255v
folio_text: Drogo/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ holds pedum in right hand and leash attached to collar on dog in left hand/ At left is second dog/ seated on ground/ In background is flock/ Figure in landscape setting with buildings/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 257r
folio_text: Rochus of Montpellier/ nimbed/ wearing hat/ raises left hand and extends right hand toward dog/ seated on ground/ At right is angel/ with right hand extended/ Scene in landscape setting/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 258r
folio_text: Catherine of Alexandria/ nimbed and crowned/ holding open book in right hand/ stands upon half figure of Maxentius/ crowned/ Scene in landscape setting/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 259r
folio_text: Margaret of Antioch: Scene/ emerging from Dragon -- Margaret/ nimbed/ with joined hands raised and cross in crook of left arm/ emerges from back of dragon/ drapery hanging out of mouth/ Scene in landscape setting/

tomb_text: Book of HoursFrance/ probably Mons/ between 1490 and 1500M/33 fol/ 260r
folio_text: Barbara of Nicomedia/ nimbed/ holding palm in right hand and open book in left hand/ sits beside tower with open portal and three windows/ Figure in landscape setting/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 38v
folio_text: Christ: before Herod Antipas -- Herod Antipas/ wearing crown/ sits on throne with legs crossed/ right hand raised and left hand holding scepter; Christ/ crossed nimbus/ stands facing him/ with hands tied and flanked by two figures in pointed hats/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 39r
folio_text: Psalm 027 (Vulg// 026):Adam: Creation -- Christ-Logos/ crossed nimbus/ raising left hand in blessing and holding book in right hand/ stands beside Adam/ nude/ hands raised in prayer/Scene on gold background in decorated initial D/In right margin/ bird/ with raised wings/ perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 62v
folio_text: Christ: Flagellation -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ in long loin cloth/ stands with hands bound to column/ body covered with bleeding wounds/ flanked by two men with scourges raised above heads/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 63r
folio_text: Psalm 039 (Vulg// 038):Eve: Creation -- Christ-Logos/ crossed nimbus/ book in right hand/ left hand raised in blessing/ stands beside Eve/ hands clasped/ nude/ issuing from side of Adam reclining/ nude/ left hand to face/Scene on gold background in decorated initial D/In right margin/ dog sits on end of foliate bar/ looking up at initial/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 83r
folio_text: Psalm 052 (Vulg// 051):Eve: tempted by Serpent -- Eve/ nude/ with apple in right and left hands/ stands beside tree up whose trunk climbs serpent/Scene on gold background in decorated initial Q/In right margin/ bird/ possibly crane/ perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 84v
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ carrying decorated blue Cross over right shoulder/ glances back toward Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ hands raised to arm of Cross; youth behind Christ pushes him with both hands; at right/ man in pointed hat holds three nails in left hand/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 85r
folio_text: Psalm 053 (Vulg// 052):Adam and Eve: Fall of Man -- Adam and Eve/ nude/ hold apple in each hand; Adam raises left hand to mouth/Scene on gold background in decorated initial D/In right margin/ bird/ possibly crane/ perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 106v
folio_text: Christ: Crucifixion -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ head bowed/ eyes closed/ bleeding from wounds in hands/ feet/ and side/ is affixed to Cross with three nails/ Breast of Virgin Mary/ scalloped nimbus/ veiled/ is pierced by sword/ Evangelist John/ nimbed/ holds book in left hand and rests chin in right hand/ Sun and moon above Cross/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 107r
folio_text: Psalm 069 (Vulg// 068):Adam and Eve: Expulsion -- Angel/ scalloped nimbus/ holds flaming sword in right hand and places left hand on shoulder of Adam/ nude/ standing beside Eve/ nude/ both covering themselves with fig leaves/Scene on gold background in decorated initial S/In right margin bird perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 132v
folio_text: Christ: Deposition -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ is removed from Cross by Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ holding his right hand; Evangelist John/ nimbed/ supports left arm still nailed to Cross; and additional figure wrapps draped arms around Christ's torso/Sun and moon in sky/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 133r
folio_text: Psalm 081 (Vulg// 080):Adam and Eve: at Labor -- 1) Eve/ seated on bench/ spins wool with distaff and spindle; 2) Adam labors with utensil/ possibly axe/Figures on gold background in decorated initial E/In right margin/ bird/ possibly crane/ perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 158v
folio_text: Christ: Entombment -- Christ/ nimbed/ wrapped in shroud/ is lowered into tomb in form of sarcophagus; one man supports his head/ another his feet/ Third man at center anoints the body with vessel in right hand; all three men wear pointed hats/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 159r
folio_text: Psalm 098 (Vulg// 097):Cain and Abel: bringing Offerings -- Flanking draped altar with cross on center of drapery/ Cain holds up sheaf of wheat while Abel holds lamb/ Hand of God at upper right held in blessing/Scene on gold background in decorated initial C/In right margin/ bird/ possibly crane/ perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 163r
folio_text: Psalm 102 (Vulg// 101):Cain: killing Abel -- Cain/ holding club over head with both hands/ stands over kneeling Abel/ hands held together and bleeding from head/Scene on gold background in decorated initial C/In right margin/ bird perches on end of foliate bar/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 187v
folio_text: Christ: Resurrection -- Christ/ crossed nimbus/ rising from sarcophagus/ holds bannered cross-staff in left hand and blesses with right hand/ He looks toward nimbed figure in white tunic holding bowl and swinging censer/ Three soldiers in chain mail sleep at foot of sarcophagus/Scene on gold background within frame decorated with architecture and abstract ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterNetherlands/ probably Utrecht/ ca/ 1290MS M/34 fol/ 188r
folio_text: Psalm 110 (Vulg// 109):Moses: Burning Bush -- Christ-Logos/ crossed nimbus/ scroll in left hand and right hand pointing down/ stands beside Moses/ bearded and in short tunic/ with raised right hand and scroll in left hand/ Small burning bush on ground between them/Scene on gold background in decorated initial D/In lower margin (bas-de-page)/ running dog/

tomb_text: Histoire du Saint-GrailBelgium/ Bruges/ 1479MS M/38 fol/ 2r
folio_text: Initial C enclosing escutcheon with arms of Ysembert Rolin (azure three keys in pale the wards upwards and to the sinster or)/ Top left corner margin with floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Histoire du Saint-GrailBelgium/ Bruges/ 1479MS M/38 fol/ 10r
folio_text: Initial O enclosing escutcheon with arms of Ysembert Rolin (azure three keys in pale the wards upwards and to the sinster or)/ Top left corner margin with floreate ornament/

tomb_text: Roman du lisFrance/ Paris/ between 1350 and 1375MS M/40 fol/ 1r
folio_text: Virgin Mary and Christ Child: with Saints -- Louis IX of France/ nimbed/ crowned/ wearing mantle inscribed with fleur-de-lis (Heraldry/ French: King of France)/ holding scepter in left hand/ stands beside Mary Magdalen/ nimbed/ veiled/ holding ointment jar in left hand/ Both place their right hands on shoulder of kneeling nun/ wearing habit/ holding object/ possibly purse or rosary/ in her joined raised hands/ Before her on bench sits Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ crowned/ and holding in her arms Christ Child/ with crossed nimbus/ holding bird (?) in right hand/Top and left margins with ivy-rinceaux ornament/ Initials with pen flourishing/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 1r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Dinadan attacking Mark of Cornwall -- Dinadan/ wearing gold helmet and armor/ holding lance with right hand/ shield at left side/ astride bridled horse/ face protected with plumed armor/ He gallops after Mark of Cornwall/ wearing plumed black helmet with gold crown/ and armor with spurs/ holding lance back over right shoulder/ astride bridled galloping horse//	Scene in landscape with houses/ castle on hill/ trees/ mountains in distance/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 6r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes attacking Knights of Round Table -- Palamedes/ wearing black helmet and armor/ raising sword with right hand is astride caparisoned horse wearing face armor with plume/ He gallops after four (?) knights/ hindmost two wearing helmets and armor/ one gold/ holding lances back over right shoulders/ astride bridled horses//	Scene in landscape with trees and rock formations in foreground/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 9r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes fighting Knight -- Palamedes confronting knight/ one wearing gold helmet and armor/ holding sword with right hand/ shield at left shoulder/ with scabbard at waist/ the other wearing gold helmet and upper body armor/ with black below/ extending left hand/ raising sword with right hand/ with scabbard at waist//	Figures in landscape with stream and trees/ houses with chimneys in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 13r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Meeting of Tristan and Lamorat -- Two men embrace/ both wearing hats on backs/ one wearing long garment/ the other tunic and hose with sword in scabbard at waist/ and spurs/ Dog stands at right//Scene in courtyard or city street with building in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 14r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Arthur reconciling Mark of Cornwall and Tristan -- In left column/ Mark of Cornwall wearing hat/ back-turned/ facing and gesturing toward the Arthur/ crowned/ raising left hand/ At right/ Tristan/ holding hat with right hand/ raising left hand//	Scene before low wall with landscape in background//	Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan going to Cornwall -- In right column/ Tristan/ wearing hat/ sword at waist mounting bridled horse/ At right/ back-turned figures on horseback/ including mean wearing hats/ and possibly woman wearing headdress//	Buildings in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 15r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot and Knights lamenting Departure of Tristan -- Of four men wearing hats/ one stands apart with arms crossed/ The other three/ one gesturing stand together//	Scene in room with doorway/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 15v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Aglovale and Perceval arriving at Court of Arthur -- Two bridled horses/ brown and gray/ standing behind Aglovale and Perceval/ one wearing black armor and helmet/ the other/ with red beard (?)/ wearing gold armor and helmet with plume/ each holding lance in right right hand/ with sword at left side//	Scene outside portal of building with wall in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 18v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Dinadan fighting Sons of King of Orkney -- Of three knights on horseback/ one wearing gold armor/ back-turned/ sword at waist/ raises right arm/ Next to him/ one of the other two wearing black armor/ raises sword with left hand; the third/ astride caparisoned horse/ holds sword with raised right hand//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 19v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Mordred and Agravain Complain to Gawain -- Of Mordred/ Agravain and Gawain/ wearing hats/ one/ arms crossed/ wears long garment/ The other two/ one gesturing with right hand/ wear short tunics/ with daggers between legs//	Figures standing amid three columns/ bounded by building and wall; trees beyond wall/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 20v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Arthur receiving Letter from Tristan -- Woman wearing hennin/ gesturing with both hands stands before Arthur/ crowned/ looking down at document held with both hands/ Four men/ one back-turned/ all wearing hats stand behind Arthur//	Scene in room with pseudo-inscription on wall/ and with door open to exterior/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 21v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Arthur reading Letter from Tristan -- Arthur/ crowned/ looking down at document with pseudo-inscription/ held with left hand/ is surrounded by five men wearing hats/ one gesturing/ two wearing daggers at waist/ one back-turned//	Figures standing in room with pilasters decorating wall/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 24v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Guinevere receiving Letter from Mark of Cornwall -- Guinevere/ wearing veiled hennin/ seated on bench/ extends left hand to letter held in right hand of messenger wearing sword at waist/ and spurs/ kneeling before her//	Scene in room with wooden ceiling and doorway open to landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 35r
Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 36r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan fighting Helias -- Helias/ wearing gold helmet with plume and gold and black armor/ head thrown back/ shield at left shoulder/ is astride rearing bridled horse with plume on head/ wearing armor/ Broken lance at feet of horse/ Helias is struck on shield by lance held by Tristan/ wearing gold helmet with black armor/ shield at left shoulder/ astride rearing bridled horse with trappings//	Wall or fence and trees in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 38r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: celebrating Victory of Tristan in Cornwall -- Of two couples/ dancing opposite each other/ the women wear veiled henins and fur-trimmed gowns/ The men/ wearing hats/ one/ with dagger at back wears long garment; the other wears tunic and hose/ Musician playing pipe and tabor stands at right/ possibly next to foot of draped bed with canopy (see fol/ 38v)//	Scene in room with wooden ceiling/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 38v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Heliot performing Lay of Dinadan -- Two men wearing hats/ each with dagger at waist/ stand at left and look toward Helyot/ wearing hat/ playing harp/ seated on bench/ Draped bed with canopy is in background//	Scene in room with tiled floor/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 40r
folio_text: Legend/ Alexander the Orphan: Alexander and Angledis arriving at Castle -- Angledis/ mother of Alexander/ crowned (?)/ hands clasped/ and Alexander/ wearing hat on cap/ stand facing man raising hat with right hand before castle//	Scene in landscape with houses with chimneys in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 41v
folio_text: Legend/ Alexander the Orphan: Morgan le Fay receiving News of Defeat of Caradoc -- Woman/ wearing headdress/ back-turned/ facing Morgan le Fay/ wearing hat with crown/ Approaching from right/ messenger/ raising hat with right hand/ holding document with left hand/ wearing sword at waist/ spurs/ Dog reclining on floor between them//	Scene in room with wooden ceiling/ window and draped bed/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 42v
folio_text: Legend/ Alexander the Orphan: Malagrin the Felon killed by Alexander the Orphan -- Alexander/ wearing black helmet and armor/ shield on back/ left hand raised to saddle/ mounting bridled horse with plume/ Severed head and body of Malagrin the Felon/ wearing black and gold armor/ reclining on ground/ Red/ shield with broken strap on ground at right//	Scene in landscape with castle on water/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 44r
folio_text: Legend/ Alexander the Orphan: Morgan le Fay seducing Alexander the Orphan -- Morgan le Fay and Alexander/ both wearing hats/ embrace and kiss/ They are standing in bedroom with draped canopy bed with bench at foot of bed; casket is under the bench/ At right/ is another bed or cushioned bench before closed door/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 47v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tournament of Galehot -- In background/ two confronted groups of mounted knights/ foremost with lances lowered/ In foreground knight on ground looking up toward two confronted knights/ astride bridled horses/ lances lowered/ Several broken lances on ground//	Scene in landscape with castle on mound in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 48v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes rescuing Maiden -- Palamedes/ wearing black and gold armor/ leans over head of knight wearing black armor/ seated on ground/ With left hand Palamedes grasps head of the knight/ and with right hand holds knife to his throat/ Sword is on ground at right/ Maiden/ wearing hennin/ stands in bushes near wall of building//	Scene in landscape with buildings/ one on mound with chimney/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 49r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes jousting for Maiden -- Knight/ wearing black armor and helmet grasping lance with right hand/ shield at left shoulder is astride bridled horse with plume and face armor/ leaping/ The knight leans backward from blow by lance held with right hand of Palamedes/ wearing gold armor/ with shield at left shoulder/ astride horse with trappings/ In background/ maiden/ wearing tall hat/ is seated sideways on horse with trappings/ All are enclosed by wall in field with trees/ Other knights/ possibly holding lances/ some astride horses/ are visible beyond the wall/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 52r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes and Safir jousting against Bleoberis and Hector of the Fens -- Of four confronted knights holding lowered lances/ astride bridled horses/ three wear black armor/ two with plumed helmets/ The fourth wears gold armor with plumed helmet//	Scene in landscape with castle on hill in background and tree in foreground/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 53r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes fighting Corsabrin -- Palamedes/ wearing gold helmet with blue banner/ black and gold armor/ extending sword with both hands/ confronting Corsabrin/ wearing gold helmet/ gold and black armor/ raising sword high overhead with both hands/ standing on tiptoes/ Two shields/ and two broken lances on ground//	Scene in landscape with trees and castle in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 56r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes and Safir jousting against Two New Knights -- Of two confronted groups of mounted knights/ some wear black armor; others wear gold armor; several hold lowered lances/ Of foremost two/ one wears black armor with red banner on helmet/ spurs/ shield at left shoulder/ and is astride bridled horse wearing face armor surmounted by red banner/ With lance in right hand/ he gallops toward knight wearing gold plumed helmet and armor/ shield at left shoulder/ sword at waist/ astride bridled leaping horse with trappings//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 57v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot disguised as Woman seeking Dinadan -- Among two confronted groups of mounted knights holding lances/ some lowered/ is Lancelot/ partly visible/ wearing veiled hennin/ and garment/ In foreground/ knight attacks another on ground/ holding sword with right hand/ grasping the other’s helmet with left hand; two knights battle with swords and shields; two other knights crouch on ground/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 58v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Guinevere admitted by Mark of Cornwall to Prison of Tristan -- Guinevere/ wearing hennin/ and back-turned man wearing hat on back/ look toward Mark of Cornwall/ crowned/ indicating with right hand tower with barred window/ where Tristan/ wearing hat is visible//	Scene in walled courtyard with portal; trees and buildings visible beyond wall/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 59v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Letter delivered to Tristan -- Man wearing long garment/ with chaperon over right shoulder/ extends letter in left hand to barred window of prison/ behind which Tristan/ wearing hat/ grasps window ledge with both hands//	Row of buildings and landscape in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 65v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan hunting -- Tristan/ wearing hat/ holding hunting horn to mouth/ is astride bridled horse/ At left/ water flows from pool through spout/ At right/ two knights/ one wearing black armor/ the other gold/ holding shields and bannered lances/ are astride bridled horses//	Trees in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 69r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan and Isolde at Joyous Guard -- Isolde/ wearing hennin with crown/ and Tristan/ wearing hat/ stand opposite each other at foot of canopied bed/ flanked by two columns in room with open door in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 77r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan/ Palamedes and Gaheris at Leverzep Castle -- Of Tristan/ Palamedes and Gaheris astride horses/ two wear gold armor/ with plumed helmets/ The other wears black and gold armor/ All carry lances/ Two horses wear trappings/ and have plumes on heads/ One wears face armor//	Figures in landscape with castle amid trees in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 81r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes killing Servant of King of City of Vermeille -- Knight wearing black armor/ bleeding from wound/ is transfixed by lance of Palamedes/ wearing gold helmet and armor/ astride leaping horse/ Another knight/ backturned/ wearing black helmet and armor/ shield at left shoulder/ lance at right/ is astride horse at right/ At left/ crown on ground next to fountain//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 90r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan taking Isolde to Tournament -- Group of knights wearing black armor follow Tristan/ wearing hat/ holding lance (incomplete ?) with right hand/ astride bridled horse wearing face armor/ Isolde/ wearing hennin/ sits sideways on horse with trappings next to him/ At right/ leading/ knight wearing black armor/ spurs/ holding lance (incomplete ?) with right hand/ is astride horse with face armor surmounted by fleur-de-lis/ and caparison inscribed with initials P and A and pseudo-inscription//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 96r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tournament at Leverzep Castle -- Two confronted groups of knights wearing armor/ lances in lowered/ astride horses/ In foreground two knights/ one wearing black armor/ the other wearing gold armor/ raising swords with right hands/ face each other astride leaping caparisoned horses//	Scene in landscape with castle in distance/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 115v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Palamedes leaving Tournament at Leverzep Castle -- In foreground/ Palamedes/ wearing gold helmet with plume/ black armor/ shield at left shoulder/ is astride bridled horse wearing face armor surmounted with fleur-de-lis/ back turned to tournament/ In background/ large group of confronted knights/ wearing helmets and armor/ many holding lances/ some lowered/ some with shields/ astride bridled horses/ some with trappings/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 128r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Arthur receiving Monk -- Monk/ wearing white cap and black habit/ possibly Benedictine/ holding staff with both hands/ kneeling on one knee before Arthur wearing hat with crown/ raising right hand/ holding rod with left hand//	Scene in room with doorway open to landscape with house in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 128v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot encountering Elaine of Corbenic at Bridge to Corbenic -- Lancelot/ wearing gold plumed helmet/ gold and black armor/ spurs/ holding lance with right hand with shield at left shoulder/ astride caparisoned horse with pseudo inscription/ wearing face armor/ passing nude Elaine/ gesturing with right hand/ standing in tub of water/ In background/ bridge to castle of Corbenic//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 130v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot betrayed by Elaine of Corbenic-- Lancelot/ wearing headgear and armor/ holding sword with right hand/ extending left hand/ approaching nude Elaine/ wearing headdress/ with joined hands/ kneeling before him/ In background/ draped bed with canopy//	Scene in bedroom/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 131r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bors de Gannes fighting to cross Bridge to Corbenic -- Standing at end of bridge of Corbenic/ knight wearing gold and black armor/ sheath of sword at waist/ holding sword with right hand and raising shield with left hand against Bors of Gannes/ wearing black helmet and gold armor/ sheath of sword at waist/ extending left hand toward the shield/ and raising sword with right hand//	Scene in landscape with castle at other end of bridge over body of water/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 135r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Guinevere discovering Lancelot and Elaine of Courbenic -- Lancelot and Elaine/ wearing headdresses/ nude/ recline/ heads on pillows in draped canopy bed/ Guinevere/ crowned/ left hand raised/ approaching the bed/ Bench at left; cupboard or doorway at right/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 136v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bors of Gannes/ Hector of the Fens and Lionel of Gannes searching for Lancelot -- Three knights/ two wearing gold helmets and armor/ the other wearing black and gold helmet and armor/ all holding lances astride bridled horses/ two with trappings/ ride away from castle at left//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 137v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Aglovale greeting Mother -- Woman/ wearing wimpled headdress is embraced and kissed by Aglovale/ wearing black and gold armor with sword at waist/ Bridled horse with trappings stands next to man holding hat//	Scene in walled courtyard/ building with doorway at left; beyond wall/ trees and castle/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 140v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Hector of the Fens and Perceval resting -- Of two knights wearing black and gold armor/ one reclines on side/ supporting bleeding head with left arm supported by shield; the other/ head bleeding/ is seated on ground/ Two swords and two shields are on ground//	Scene in landscape with bridled horse with trappings at left and house in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 142r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Meeting of Lancelot and Bliant -- At left Bliant/ wearing hat/ extending left hand to raised right hand of small man on ground/ At right/ Lancelot/ extending left hand/ raising sword with right hand/ looking toward shield hanging in tree//	Scene in landscape with tent decorated with pseudo-inscription/ sheath of sword on ground and two lances leaning against trees/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 147r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Perceval in Combat with Lancelot -- Perceval and Lancelot/ wearing armor/ one with plumed gold helmet/ both with sheaths at waists/ holding or raising swords with right hands/ shields at left shoulders/ confront each other on bank of stream in landscape with castle at right/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 148v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bors of Gannes bringing Helain the White to Arthur for Knighthood -- Of four men wearing hats/ two wear long garments; two wear tunics/ one carrying dagger with right hand and holding spear (?) on left shoulder/ At right/ back-turned man/ with dagger at waist/ stands before Arthur/ crowned/ and cleric (?) holding book open facing out//	Scene in walled courtyard with doorway at right; trees visible beyond the wall/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 149v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bors of Gannes finding Son Helain the White -- In left column/ two men wearing hats and tunics/ with swords at waists/ face each other/ one indicating two men at right/ One wears hat with sword at waist/ and extends arms to man raising hat with right hand/ extending left hand/ He wears bi-colored hose/ with dagger at waist/ Three men wear spurs//	Scene in room with window with colonnade//	Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Hermit prophesying to Arthur -- In right column/ monk wearing habit/ raising right hand/ looks toward Arthur/ crowned/ holding spear with right hand/ wearing hunting horn on cord over left shoulder/ and sword at waist//	Scene in landscape with building/ possibly church at left/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 150v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan departing Joyous Guard with Isolde -- Isolde/ crowned/ standing next to Tristan/ wearing black armor with gold plume on helmet/ holding lance (?) with right hand/ shield at left shoulder/ astride bridled horse with trappings//	Scene in landscape with castle/ bridge over stream to castle portal/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 158v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bagdemagus fighting White Knight -- Two confronted knights wearing armor/ holding lowered lances with right hands and shields at left shoulders are astride bridled horses with trappings/ Bagdemagus is at left/ wearing black helmet and armor/ with gold crown on the helmet//	Scene in landscape with church and houses amid trees in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 161v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Meliant of Dianarca pursued by Knight -- Knight wearing black armor with plumed helmet/ holding lance with right hand/ astride galloping bridled horse with trappings pursues Meliant of Dianarca/ wearing gold armor/ holding lance with right hand/ astride bridled horse with plume on head//	Scene in landscape with trees/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 163v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Gawain and Gaheris visiting Wounded Meliant of Dianarca -- Gawain or Gaheris/ wearing gold helmet and armor/ holding lance with left hand stands next to draped canopy bed where nude Melian/ wearing hat/ reclines/ Monk wearing hood/ hands in sleeves/ stands at left/ Visible through open doorway/ Gawain or Gaheris/ wearing gold armor with plumed helmet/ holding lance with right hand/ shield at left shoulder is astride bridled horse with trappings/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 164v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Knights jousting -- Of three knights/ one/ wearing black plumed helmet and armor/ holding lowered lance with right hand with gold and silver shield at left shoulder/ is astride bridled horse with trappings/ He gallops toward two other knights wearing gold/ or black and gold/ armor/ holding lowered lances/ shields at left shoulders/ astride bridled horses/ one with trappings//	Scene in landscape with trees/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 178v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan receiving Message from Isolde -- Tristan/ wearing gold plumed helmet and armor/ spurs/ with sword at waist/ holding message open with both hands stands next to fountain/ Messenger/ holding hat with right hand/ left hand on hilt of sword/ wearing spurs/ stands before him next to bridled horse//	Scene in landscape with trees in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 189v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad fighting Knights -- Galahad/ wearing black helmet and armor/ with spurs/ raising sword with right hand is astride leaping horse with trappings/ wearing face armor surmounted by plume/ He follows two knights/ wearing gold helmets and armor/ carrying lances over right shoulders/ astride bridled horses with trappings/ Other knights/ some carrying lances on shoulders are in background//	Scene in landscape with hills and tree/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 193r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan preparing to Fight Palamedes -- Man wearing dagger at back/ gesturing with both hands and second man wearing hat/ hunting horn on strap over left shoulder/ raising both hands/ look toward Tristan wearing black and gold helmet and armor/ grasping rod with right hand and hilt of sword with left hand//	Scene in bedroom with draped canopy bed/ Pseudo-inscription on the canopy and on wall/ Open door at left/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 197v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan approaching Castle -- Tristan/ wearing plumed gold helmet and black armor/ grasping rod (?) with right hand/ sword at waist/ spurs/ is astride bridled horse with trappings//	Scene in landscape with road curving toward castle in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 199r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan rescued by Palamedes -- On platform supported by tall barrels/ executioner/ wearing hat/ holding sword with right hand/ wearing sheath of sword at waist/ extends left hand to head of Tristan/ wearing white tunic/ covered hands crossed/ kneeling before block of wood/ Ladder is at far side of the platform/ Palamedes/ wearing gold plumed helmet and armor/ shield at left shoulder/ lance at right side/ is astride bridled horse next to the platform/ Horseman/ wearing hat/ holding rod with left hand/ and group of men wearing hats/ most only partially visible/ some holding spears/ are at right/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 200v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Knights jousting -- Of two knights astride confronted charging bridled horses with trappings/ one wears black armor/ lance in right hand pointed toward ground/ The other knight/ wearing gold plumed helmet and armor/ shield at left shoulder/ lance at right side touching the first knight//	Scene in landscape with castle in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 201v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Knights jousting -- At left/ one of two horsemen wears hat; the other wearing gold and black armor/ spurs/ lance under right arm is astride leaping bridled horse with face armor surmounted by plume/ and trappings/ He follows knight wearing gold armor and spurs/ holding with right hand/ lance over right shoulder/ astride leaping bridled horse with trappings/ Other knights/ wearing black armor/ holding lances over shoulders/ are in background at right//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 205v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan/ Palamedes and Knight of Green Shield fighting Knights -- At left/ of Tristan/ Palamedes and Knight of Green Shield/ one wears gold armor/ two wear black armor/ two hold lowered lances with right hands/ shields at left shoulders/ and one/ wearing spurs/ raises sword with right hand/ All gallop behind large group of mounted knights/ one wearing gold armor/ carrying lances over shoulders//	Scene in landscape with house in background and castle on hill/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 220r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Gawain fighting Breus the Pitiless -- At left knight wearing black helmet and armor/ holds lowered lance with right hand/ shield at left shoulder/ He is astride leaping horse bleeding from wound by spear held in right hand of second knight wearing black helmet with gold armor/ sword in sheath hanging from waist//	Scene in landscape with houses with chimneys and castle on hill in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 238v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot meeting Hermit -- Lancelot/ wearing black helmet and armor/ is seated on bench next to hermit/ wearing hood and cloak/ raising right hand/ holding staff with left hand/ seated//	Scene inside wattle fence next to building; trees visible beyond the fence/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 244v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bors of Gannes with Hermit -- Hermit/ possibly wearing habit beneath cloak/ is astride donkey (ass)/ He is followed by Bors/ wearing black plumed helmet and armor/ astride bridled horse/ They ride along road in landscape; building with windows is behind wall in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 251v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad removing Skull of Lancelot/ King of Gaul and Ireland/ from Fountain -- Galahad/ wearing black plumed helmet and armor/ holding skull with both hands/ leans over pool surrounding fountain/ Bridled horse stands behind him; two lions sit next to the fountain//	Scene in landscape/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 252v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad jousting with Gawain -- Galahad wearing black plumed helmet and armor/ raising sword with right hand/ shield at left shoulder/ astride horse leaping toward Gawain/ wearing gold helmet and armor/ raising right arm/ astride leaping bridled horse with trappings/ Third knight/ Brandelis/ back-turned/ wearing black armor/ is astride horse at right//	Scene in landscape

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 253r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Tristan pursuing Galahad -- Galahad/ wearing gold plumed helmet and armor/ shield at left shoulder/ sword at waist/ is astride bridled horse/ head surmounted by plume/ He is followed by Tristan/ wearing black plumed helmet and armor/ holding rod (?) with right hand/ sword at waist/ is astride bridled horse with plume surmounting head/ and trappings//	Scene in landscape at edge of forest/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 257r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad pursuing Three Knights -- Galahad/ wearing gold helmet and black armor/ right arm extended back/ possibly holding sword/ at left shoulder/ shield decorated with his heraldry (argent a cross gules)/ is astride leaping horse wearing armor/ face armor surmounted by plumes/ He pursues three knights wearing black helmets and armor/ holding lances over right shoulders/ the foremost/ with spurs/ astride leaping bridled/ caparisoned horse//	Scene in landscape with buildings with chimneys in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 259v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Bors of Gannes and Perceval welcoming Galahad and Noblewoman on Ship -- Bors/ Perceval and Galahad/ wearing tall hats/ and woman wearing hennin are on sailing ship/ with billowing sail/ anchor secured on side//	Seascape with houses with chimneys on far shore; buildings on hill in distance/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 263r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad/ Perceval and Bors of Gannes encountering Caiaphas -- Caiaphas/ raising left hand/ crouching in niche in tall outcropping/ looks toward Galahad/ Perceval and Bors/ all wearing gold armor/ one with sword at waist/ one with plumed helmet and spurs/ all holding lances/ astride bridled horses//	Scene in landscape amid trees on shore of body of water; buildings visible in distance/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 267v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad and Perceval at Burning Castle -- Galahad and Perceval/ wearing black helmets and armor/ holding spears/ one with sword at waist/ stand under portico/ one looking toward castle in rain (?) with flames rising from windows//	Scene in landscape with rocky outcrops/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 268r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Arthur and Mark of Cornwall in Battle -- Of soldiers wearing helmets and armor/ two hold spears; two raise swords/ one holds shield; another crouches/ a halberd near his head held by a second soldier/ Of many in background/ most are partially visible; many hold spears/ some bannered/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 269v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Arthur the Less and Palamedes fighting -- Arthur the Less and Palamedes/ one wearing black helmet and gold and black armor/ the other wearing gold armor/ confronting each other/ one raising sword with both hands wearing shield on back/ the other raising shield on left arm/ aiming spear with right hand/ wearing sword at waist//	Scene in landscape with buildings including houses with chimneys and church with weather vane and bell in tower in background/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 273r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Mark of Cornwall poisoning Galahad -- Mark of Cornwall/ crowned/ raising left hand/ looks toward Galahad/ wearing hat/ sword at waist/ raising cup to lips with right hand/ Another man/ wearing hat/ with hat on back/ dagger at waist/ looks on//	Scene in room with colonnade and decorated doorway at end/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 276v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot sleeping -- Lancelot/ wearing hat/ reclines on shore/ head on stone (?)/ flanked by shield and helmet/ and by spear leaning against tree/ At left ship with anchor secured to side/ is in water/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 277v
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad and Companions visiting Ill Tristan -- In left column/ Tristan/ nude/ wearing headgear/ head on pillow/ reclines in draped canopy bed/ Galahad and two knights/ wearing gold and black armor/ two with swords at waists/ two holding spears/ two back-turned/ stand next to the bed//	Scene in room with opening flanked by columns//	Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Mark of Cornwall returning to Cornwall -- Mark of Cornwall/ crowned/ holding rod (?) with left hand/ astride bridled horse with trappings/ rides behind four horseman/ two only partially visible/ Another horseman/ holding rod (?) with left hand/ follows Mark//	Scene in landscape with tower on mound in background with houses/ some with chimneys/ below/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 279r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Galahad approaching Ship of Lancelot -- Galahad/ wearing black helmet with plume and armor/ sword at waist/ and spurs/ is astride caparisoned horse with face armor surmounted by plume/ Name GALAAD is inscribed on horse/ He is on road leading to ship on sea/

tomb_text: Roman de TristanFrance/ probably Bourges/ April 15/ 1468MS M/41 fol/ 282r
folio_text: Legend/ Tristan and Isolde: Lancelot ejected from Grail Chamber -- Lancelot/ wearing black and gold armor/ sword at waist/ spurs/ falling backward/ hand grasping left (?) leg/ At right tall gold tabernacle/ flanked by two candle sticks/ rests on draped altar in room with architectural decoration on dado surmounted by pseudo-inscription/ Lancelot falls through door open to exterior/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 1r
folio_text: Escutcheon with red lion/ wearing crown/ is flanked by two unicorns/ Above escutcheon is second crown/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 1v
folio_text: Louis XII of France/ wearing hat/ seated in draped throne beneath canopy/ extends left hand to grasp book held in both hands of Pierre Gringore/ kneeling on one knee/ Behind him are six men/ wearing hats/ two holding halberds/ Scene in vaulted room/ with portal and arcade open onto landscape setting/ Scene is surrounded by architectural frame/ on top of which are half-figures of angels/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 4r
folio_text: Nun (personification of hypocrisy)/ veiled/ holds in right hand statue of monk (?) and crucifix/ On her habit is inscription PAPELARDESE/ She extends left hand/ upon which is miter (?) toward man/ wearing hat/ with purse at waist/ holding statues of bishop and cardinal over his left shoulder/ Beneath him is inscription ERREVR/ At left is woman (personification of impiety)/ wearing headdress/ with hands raised/ Below her is inscription/ FAVLT DE FOY/In background is building with portal and windows/ inscribed LEGLISE/Figures are surrounded by architectural frame/ on top of which are two putti/ At bottom of frame/ third putto/ as half figure/ with four wings/ emerges from scallop/ and holds in both hands flowers/ one of which is thistle/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 8v
folio_text: Holy Ghost -- At top of miniature is dove of holy Ghost/ cross-nimbed/ in clouds/ emitting rays/Below is woman/ wearing headdress (personification of Election)/ holds cross staff/ Above her is scroll with inscription/ ELECTION/ Beside her is Cardinal (personification of Religious Benefit)/ with right forefinger raised/ Above him is scroll inscribed GRANT BENEFICE/ They stand behind man (personification of Pragmatism)/ wearing hood/ kneeling with hands raised/ He surmounts scroll with inscription PRAGMATIQVE/At right is tonsured priest (personification of Religious Benefit)/ holding in both hands open book with pseudo-inscription/ Above him is scroll with inscription PETIT BENEFICE/ He stands beside woman (personification of Religious appointment)/ holding lamb in both hands/ Above her is scroll with inscription NOMINACION/ and at her feet are flock of sheep and sheaf of wheat/Figures are in landscape setting and are surrounded by architectural frame/ on top of which are two putti/ holding garland/ At bottom of frame/ third putto/ as half figure/ is in shell/ and holds in both hands two garlands/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 12v
folio_text: Medusa/ Euriale/ and Sthenno (Gorgons)/ wearing headdresses/ with snakes as hair/ hold flower/ mirror/ and comb/ Behind them are piles of stones with men's heads/ Scene in landscape setting/ above which is inscription/ LES GORGONNES/Surrounding miniature is architectural frame/ on top of which are two putti/ holding garland/ At bottom of frame/ is garland and vase/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 15r
folio_text: Woman (Siren)/ with wings/ body of bird/ and tail of dragon (?)/ holds harp in right hand and trumpet in left hand/ Surrounding her/ in water/ are eight men/ wearing hats/Figures are in landscape setting and are surrounded by architectural frame/ at sides of which are four putti/ holding garland/ At bottom of frame/ fifth putto/ as half figure/ is in scallop/ and holds in both hands ends of the garlands/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 22v
folio_text: Man (personification of Blasphemy)/ wearing hat/ holds sword in raised right hand/ Below him is inscription BLAPHEME/ He stands beside woman (personification of Earth)/ her dress covered with flowers and with inscription LA TERRE/ On her shoulders is man (personification of Trouble)/ wearing hat/ holding serpent in left hand and arrow in right hand/ Above him is inscription INCONVENIENT/ Touching his left leg is man (personification of Cupidity)/ wearing hat/ surmounted by inscription ACCVERRE/In background are four piles of playing cards/Figures are surrounded by architectural frame/ at bottom of which is putto holding garlands in both hands/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 26v
folio_text: Male blasphemer is bound by neck to column/ Man/ wearing hat/ transfixes him in mouth with knife/ Behind them is group of men/ all wearing hats/ astride horses/ and man/ wearing hat/ holding spear in right hand/ In background are two halberds and spear/ Figures are amid buildings of city/ In draped window above is half figure of king/ wearing crown/ holding scepter in right hand/Miniature is surrounded by architectural frame/ at top of which are two putti/ holding garland/ At bottom of frame are two half-figures of putti in shells/ extending their hands toward each other/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 33r
folio_text: Man (personification of Judgement)/ sits on bench/ He holds roll in right hand and extends left hand/ Beside him is scroll with inscription IVDGEMENT/ Behind him is woman (personification of Justice)/ wearing blindfold/ seated with hands bound/ Above her is scroll with inscription IVSTICE/ Beside her is king (personification of Magnanimity)/ wearing crown/ seated with scepter in each hand/ Above him is scroll with inscription LE MAGNANIME/ At right is woman (personification of Law)/ seated holding sword in right hand and scales in left hand/ Above her is scroll with inscription LA COVRT/Figures are in room decorated with curtain bearing fleur-de-lis and pseudo-inscription/ They are surrounded by architectural frame/ on top of which are two putti/ holding garland/ At bottom of frame/ third putto/ as half figure/ is in shell/ and holds in both hands two garlands/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 38v
folio_text: Man (personification of Military)/ wearing armor and holding halberd in left hand/ stands beside clergy (personification of Church)/ wearing hat/ At right is man (personification of Nobility)/ wearing hat/ holding roll in right hand and sack in left hand/ beside man (personification of Labor)/ wearing hat/ with axe in right hand and curved knife in left hand/Figures are in landscape setting/ surrounded by architectural frame/ on top of which are two winged putti/ holding garland/ At bottom of frame is head of third putto/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 44v
folio_text: God/ nimbed/ in cloud-edged arc of heaven/ rayed/ holds crown surmounting heart in right hand and cross-surmounted globe in left hand/ He is surrounding by rays and flanked by angels with joined hands raised/Below him at left is group of soldiers/ wearing hats/ youth/ and bishop with miter/ holding crozier in left hand/Below at right is group of soldiers/ wearing armor/ most with only tops of helmets visible/ Some hold halberds and others hold spears/ The foremost holds spear in right/ shield in left hand/ and has sword at waist/Figures are in landscape setting/ They are surrounded by architectural frame/ with putto hanging from garland on left side/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 47r
folio_text: Louis XII of France: Scene/ Battle against Venetians -- Louis XII/ wearing armor/ with mantle decorated with fleur-de-lis/ holds sword in right hand/ and is astride horse/ with drapery decorated with fleur-de-lis/Behind him are two men/ wearing hats/ one with purse at waist and roll in right hand/ Behind them is group of soldiers/ wearing armor/ holding spears and halberds/Reclining on ground are soldiers/ wearing armor/ bleeding from wounds/Figures are in landscape setting/ surrounded by architectural frame/ with two putti hanging from garland on either side of frame/ Within arch at top is half-figure of angel/ nimbed/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 49r
folio_text: Allegory: League of Cambrai -- At top is two-headed eagle (representing Holy Roman Empire)/ and porcupine (representing Louis XII of France)/ Quills of the porcupine descend toward and transfix lion (representing Venice)/ seated on ground/ Below are two dogs (representing Ferdinand of Aragon)/ beside oak tree (representing Pope Julius II)/ Figures are in landscape setting/ in which is body of water with two ships/Scene is surrounded by architectural frame/ with garland/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 51r
folio_text: Goose is held over stone by nun/ holding hammer in right hand/ and three monks/ one of which holds hammer in right hand/Figures are in landscape setting/ They are surrounded by architectural frame/ with putti hanging from garland on right of frame/

tomb_text: Les abus du mondeFrance/ Rouen/ ca/ 1510M/42 fol/ 55r
folio_text: Scene/ Occupational: Doctoring and Scene/ Occupational: Barbering -- Man/ wearing headgear/ reclines in bed/ His right hand is held by right hand of doctor/ wearing hat/ holding urinal in raised left hand/ Beside bed is table/ upon which are three cups and small jar/ Dog reclines on floor next to bed/ Figures are beneath canopy/In background is barber/ wearing hat/ holding knife in both hands/ in front of fool/ wearing hood with asses ears/ seated/ with bowl in lap/Scene is surrounded by architectural frame/ with four putti hanging from garland/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 7r
folio_text: 1) Creation Scene: 4th Day -- Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ sits on bench/ with right hand raised and disk in draped left hand/ He looks toward sun/ crescent moon/ and eleven stars/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CEST LE OUERE DEL QUART IOUR KANT DEX FIST SOLAIL E LUNE E LES ESTAILES EN LE FIRMAMENT/2) Creation Scene: 6th Day/ and Eve: Creation -- Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ stands with right hand raised in blessing/ With left hand/ He holds rib of half figure of Eve/ with hands raised/ issuing from side of Adam seated sleeping on mound/ Two birds and four animals/ including ram/ mule/ and ox/ look on/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CEST LE OUERE DEL SIME IOUR KANT DEX FIST BESTES EN TERRE E ADAM E DE LUY EUE/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 7v
folio_text: 1) Adam and Eve: Fall of Man -- Eve holds two apples/ one in jaw of dragon entwined around tree/ beside Adam with right hand raising apple to mouth and holding apple in left hand/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI MANIAINT ADAM E EUE DE LA POMME ENCOUNTRE DEFENS DES P(AR) ENTICEMENT DE LA SERPENTE/2) Adam and Eve: Expulsion -- Nimbed angel/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ extends flaming sword in right hand and with left hand ushers Adam and Eve/ both with hands raised and covered with fig leaves/ toward open portal/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI SUNT ESIETUZ ADA(M) E EUE DE PARAYS E LANGELE OVEKE LESPEYE ENFLAMME GARDE LA PORTE/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 8r
folio_text: 1) Cain and Abel: bringing Offerings -- Cain raises sheaf of wheat and Abel raises horned lamb on their draped hands; they flank draped altar/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI OFFRE CAIN DES GARBES E ABEL DES AIGNELS/2) Cain: killing Abel -- Cain with jawbone strikes head of Abel/ bleeding/ looking back at him/ with hands raised/ partly kneeling/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI TUE CAIN ABEL SUN FRERE PAR ENUIE/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 8v
folio_text: 1) Cain: cursed -- Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ emerges from cloudy arc of heaven/ with scroll in right hand raised toward Cain with scroll in left hand and right hand raised/Lamech: slaying Man -- To right/ Lamech/ blind (no pupils)/ releases arrow from bow in his left hand/ piercing throat of man/ eyes closed/ gesturing beside tree/ Youth touches Lamech's garment and points to the stricken man/Scene captions in Anglo-Norman French/ CAIN EST ENCHASSE DE DEX E PUS EST TUE P(AR) LAMECH QI QUI DOIT KE IL UIT ESTE UNE AUTRE BESTE/ KAR IL NE POAIT BEN UER E PUS TUAIT SON PAGE P(UR) CEO KE IL NE LI GARNIST/2) Noah: Building of Ark -- Noah holds axe and plank/ before planks of wood and partially built ark of three tiers with animal-headed prow/ Its keel rests on four furcae supports/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI FEST NOE LA NEIF/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 9r
folio_text: 1) Noah: in Ark -- At door of ark with animal-headed prows on waters in which are fishes and eel/ Noah extends hands toward dove flying toward him/ Raven pecks at animal on land/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI RESCEIT NOE LE COLUMB EN LA NEIF E LE CORF DEMOIRT SUR CAROIGNE/2) Noah: Nakedness -- Shem and Japheth/ with averted faces/ cover with garment Noah/ wearing round/ knobbed hat/ sleeping with right arm raised to head/ seated on chair; Ham gestures and departs to right/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI DORT NOE NEU ET CHAM SUN FIZ LE MOKE ET LES AUTRES DEUS LE COUERENT SEM ET JAPHET/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 9v
folio_text: 1) Tower of Babel: Building -- On scaffolding of tower with closed portals/ two of four workmen extend hands; the third holds adze or axe; and the fourth/ seated/ lays brick and holds trowel/ Below/ one of four workmen holds basket of objects/ The second/ bearing sack on shoulders/ mounts ladder/ Flanking tub/ the third holds implement/ and the fourth digs with spade/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI FOUNT IL LA TOUR DE BABEL KANT LES LANGES FURENT DEUISEES/2) Abraham: Rescue of Lot -- Mounted soldier/ in mail/ wearing helmet/ armed with sword and shield/ accompanies Abraham/ wearing conical helmet/ mounted/ armed with decorated shield/ With sword in right hand/ he strikes head of one of four crowned kings in mail/ One/ struck/ is armed with decorated shield and sheathed sword/ Two of three mounted depart to right/ The fourth/ decapitated/ with one leg severed/ hands raised/ is on ground/Illustration of Genesis 14:15/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI TUE ABRAHAM E SA CUMPAIGNIE LES TREIS REIES RESCOUT LOTH SON NEUEU/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 10r
folio_text: 1) Abraham: blessed by Melchisedek -- Melchisedek/ white-haired and bearded/ extends on draped hands goblet (chalice) and round loaf toward Abraham/ wearing cap/ with right hand raised; both stand/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI ISSIT MELCHISEDECH LE CHAPELAIN DEX A REIS DE SALEM OF PAIN E VIN ENCONTRANT ABRAHAM APRES LA VICTOYRE/2) Abraham: entertaining the Angels -- Abraham/ seated on bench/ bends with joined hands raised toward three nimbed angels/ with hands raised/ seated on bench; two point with left hands toward Abraham/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VIT ABRAHAM TREIS ANGELES A ADORA LE UN/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 10v
folio_text: 1) Lot: barring Sodomites -- Four Sodomites stand; one addresses with left forefinger raised/ Inside house/ Lot raises left hand and places right hand on shoulder of one of two daughters/ One daughter raises right hand in front of portal toward the Sodomites; the other points to Lot/ To right/ two nimbed angels/ gesturing/ sit on bench/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI HERBERIA LOTH LES ANGELES ET TEND SES DEUS FILLES A LA MALE GENT DE LA CITE/2) Sodom and Gomorrah: Destruction -- Rays of fire fall on city of Sodom; three towers topple (earthquake)/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI DESTRUIT DEX SODOME ET GOMOR PUR LEUR PECHE/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 11r
folio_text: 1) Abraham: sacrificing Isaac -- Nimbed angel emerges from above/ with right hand grasping blade of sword held in right hand of Abraham looking back/ Kneeling/ he grasps with left hand head of Isaac crouching with joined hands raised on draped altar/ To right/ ram appears on branch of tree/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VOLEIT ABRAHAM OFFRIR YSAAC SON FIZ A DEX MES LANGELE LE VIEA ET IL VIT UN MOTUN E LOFFRIT/2) Isaac: meeting Rebecca -- Eliezer/ mounted/ extends right hand toward Rebecca/ removing veil/ mounted on camel/ encountering Isaac/ with right hand raised/ accompanied by male attendant/ both mounted/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VINT REBECCA PUR ESTRE FAMME YSAAC E SE COUERISTE KANT VIT SON SEIGNUR/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 11v
folio_text: 1) Jacob: instructed by Rebecca -- Rebecca/ veiled/ extends on her draped left hand white kid grasped by Jacob/Isaac: blessing Jacob -- To right/ Jacob extends white kid toward Issac/ white-haired and bearded/ eyes closed/ raising his right hand in blessing/ seated on draped four-post bed and leading against pillow/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI PORTE IACOB DES CHERIZ A SON PERE YSAAC A MANGER E RESCUIT SA BENEYSON/2) Isaac: Esau bringing Venison -- Esau brings venison toward Jacob/ white-haired and bearded/ eyes closed/ seated on draped four-post bed and leaning against decorative pillow/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VINT ESAU LAUTRE FRERE OVOKE SA VENESON E DEMANDE SA BENEYSON MES T(RO)P VINT TART/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 12r
folio_text: 1) Jacob: wrestling with Angel -- Nimbed angel/ barefooted/ wrestles with Jacob/ grimacing/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI LOTEIT IACOB OVOKE LANGELE/2) Jacob: sending Sons to Egypt -- Four of eleven standing sons gesture toward Jacob extending right hand toward vessel of green coins (money) held by the foremost/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI DOUNE IACOB MONOYE A SES FIZ DACHATER VIAUNDES EN EGIPTE MES MALEYNT KE DIS A CELE HOURE/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 12v
folio_text: 1) Joseph: before Potiphar's Wife -- Potiphar/ veiled/ seated on bench/ seizes with left hand mantle of Joseph looking back/ raising hands/ and departing to right/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VOLEIT LA DAME IOSEPH KE IL EVIT PECCHE OVOKE LI E LE PRIST P(AR) LE MANTEL E IL LE LESSA E SENFUIST/2) Joseph: as Interpreter of Dreams -- Joseph gestures with right forefinger and raised left hand toward butler and baker with their wrists and ankles bound; all are seated/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI CONTINT LE BOTILLER ET LE PANETER LEURS SONGES A IOSEPH EN P(RI)SONE E IL LES EPOUNT/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 13r
folio_text: 1) Moses: Burning Bush -- Moses/ nimbed/ horned/ barefooted/ steps beside black shoes toward Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right forefinger raised/ seated amid flaming bush/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VIT MOYSES DEX EN LE BUISSON ARDANT E DEX LI COMANDOIT DESCHAUCER/2) Moses: crossing Red Sea -- Five soldiers/ in mail/ including four wearing helmets/ and three swords lie in Red Sea/ divided by rod held in right hand of horned Moses/ with left hand raised before group of Israelites departing to right/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI PASSE MOYSES E SA CUMPAIGNIE LA MER E LA GENZ DE EGIPTE SUNT NEEZ/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 13v
folio_text: 1) Moses: crossing Red Sea (Israelites scavenging Egyptians' Armor) -- Four Israelite men gather two mail hauberks/ and two of three helmets; the other helmet and two swords lie on shore; Red Sea in foreground/ No scene caption/2) Moses: receiving Law -- Moses/ nimbed/ horned/ steps forward/ receiving Tables of law from right hand of Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ standing with left forefinger raised/ before mount/ Scene within architectural setting/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI DONA NOSTRE SEIGNUR LA LEY A MOYSES/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 14r
folio_text: 1) Moses: breaking Tables of Law -- Moses/ nimbed/ horned/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ steps forward/ breaking with right hand tablets on gold calf on column; one valve of the Tables is falling/ Scene within architectural setting/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI DEBRISE MOYSES LES TABLES OVECKE LA LEY PUR LE VEL DE OR QEO LE POPLE AUOIT FEST E AORE CU(M) DEX/2) Joshua: Conquest of Jericho -- Three towers of city of Jericho topple; outside city wall/ Joshua/ nimbed/ blows horn/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI CHEENT LES TOURS E LES MURS DE IERICO KANT LES LES CHAPELEINS DE LA LEY SONERENT LEURS BUSINES/ CI CESSENT LES ESTOYRES DE EXOR(DE) E COMENCENT LES ESTOYRES DE IOSUE/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 14v
