folio_text: 1) Jephthah: met by Daughter -- Female attendant/ with right hand raised/ stands by daughter playing harp/ before Jephthah/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ with right hand raised/ accompanied by male figure/ Scene within architectural setting/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI VINT LA FILIE GEPTE EN CU(N)TRE SUN PERE PUR FERE MELODIE PUR SA VICTORIE/2) Jephthah: Sacrifice -- Jephthah with left hand seizes hair of his daughter/ kneeling on mound with joined hands/ and with sword in his right hand strikes her neck/ bleeding/ Scene within architectural setting/Scene caption in Anglo-Norman French/ CI TUA GEPTE SA FILIE PUR CEO KE WUA KE IL TUEREIT KIL KE IL P(RI)MIS ENKU(N)TEREIT/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 15r
folio_text: 1) Elkanah: with Hannah and Peninnah -- Peninnah/ veiled/ drinks from goblet in left hand and with her right hand touches one of two fishes in vessels on draped table set with knife/ loaves/ and breadsticks/ Elkanah raises left forefinger toward Hannah/ veiled/ showing palm of her left hand/ All behind the table/ in architectural setting/2) Hannah: questioned by Eli -- Hannah/ veiled/ partly kneels with joined hands raised/ behind Elkanah bending and gesturing toward draped altar/ beside Eli/ nimbed/ seated/ with palm of right hand shown and with book in left hand/Scene in architectural setting (triple arcade)/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 15v
folio_text: 1) Samuel: Birth -- With her head resting on her right arm on pillow/ Hannah reclines on draped four-post bed on which sits veiled midwife showing palm of her right hand/ In background/ infant Samuel/ nimbed/ head draped/ swaddled/ lies in crib/ beneath flaming lamp between two curtains drawn to sides/2) Samuel: brought to Eli -- Elkanah stands beside Hannah/ veiled/ presenting seated child Samuel/ orant/ toward decorated altar behind which is Eli/ nimbed/ raising right hand/ Scene in architectural setting (triple arcade)/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 16r
folio_text: 1) Saul: anointed -- Samuel/ nimbed/ raises right hand and with vessel of affusion in left hand anoints head of young Saul/ orant/ in tunic/ beside tower with one of two portals open/ Scene in architectural setting/2) Saul: Rending of Garment -- Saul/ crowned/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ raises left forefinger/ and rends garment of Samuel/ nimbed/ with right palm of hand shown/ looking back at the king/Scene in architectural setting with two portals/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 16v
folio_text: 1) David: anointed -- Samuel/ nimbed/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ steps forward/ and raises vessel of affusion above head of young David/ with right hand raised and pedum in left hand/ Scene in architectural setting with two portals/2) David: slinging at Goliath -- Young David/ with pedum in left hand/ extends sling with stone in his right hand/ He looks toward Goliath wearing mail coif and helmet/ bleeding in forehead/ standing/ armed with spear/ sheathed sword in belt/ and shield/ Scene in architectural setting/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 17r
folio_text: 1) David: beheading Goliath -- Young David stands on fallen Goliath in hauberk with cap; his helmet falls to ground/ With sword in both hands/ the youth strikes the giant's neck from which blood flows/ Scene in architectural setting/2) Saul: Death/ and Jonathan: Death (?) -- Saul/ crowned/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ transfixed with sword in breast/ falls forward/ Jonathan or armor-bearer/ in hauberk/ wearing helmet/ mounted/ armed with sheathed sword/ shield and broken lance/ grimaces and blood flows from his head/ Scene in architectural setting/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 17v
folio_text: 1) Absalom: Death -- Absalom/ eyes closed/ hangs by hair around branch of tree; bridled/ saddled horse runs away/2) Absalom: Death -- Joab/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ mounted on dappled/ bridled horse/ thrusts lance into breast of Absalom/ eyes closed/ hung by hair around branch of one of two flanking trees/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 18r
folio_text: 1) Zacharias: Annunciation -- Six men in group stand; two gesture toward Zacharias/ wearing High Priest's round cap/ swinging censer toward draped altar behind which is nimbed angel raising hands toward him/ Scene in building of triple arcade/2) John Baptist: Birth -- With her head resting on right hand on pillow/ Elizabeth reclines on draped four-post bed/ Infant John Baptist/ nimbed/ wrapped in cloth/ lies in crib/ beside midwife/ veiled/ seated on bench/ Scene within architectural setting/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 18v
folio_text: 1) John Baptist: Naming -- Zacharias sits on cushioned bench/ with feet on footrest/ writing with stylus in right hand on tablet in left hand/ Scroll/ inscribed SIT NOME(N) D(OMI)NI BENEDICTV(M)/ issues from his mouth/ Two male figures/ standing/ gesture toward him/ Scene in architectural setting/ with one valve of portal open/2) Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Archangel Gabriel/ nimbed/ with scroll in left hand/ steps forward and raises right forefinger toward veiled/ nimbed Virgin Mary/ She raises right hand and holds book in draped left hand/ beside cushioned bench/ Scene in architectural setting/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 19r
folio_text: 1) Virgin Mary: Visitation -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ embraces Elizabeth/ nimbed/ veiled/ with her left hand on the Virgin's abdomen/ Both stand beside cushioned chair/ with footstool or book on ground/ between two curtains drawn to sides of arch in architectural setting/2) Christ: Nativity -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ leaning against pillow/ with right hand to head/ sits on draped four-post bed/ She extends her left hand toward Joseph the Carpenter/ nimbed/ with head resting on raised right hand/ seated on chair/In center background/ Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ head and body in cloth/ lies in four-post bed in front of ass and ox (heads visible only)/ Scene with curtain drawn to side/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 19v
folio_text: 1) Shepherds: Annunciation -- Nimbed angel/ with scroll in left hand and right forefinger raised/ approaches two standing shepherds/ One/ bearded/ in sleeveless tunic/ holds tau-staff in left hand and raises right hand above his head/ shielding his eyes/ The other/ hooded/ raises right hand and holds pan-pipes in left hand/ In foreground of grassy hillock/ two horned sheep/ goat nibbling tree/ and pet dog standing on hind legs/2) Magi: before Herod the Great -- Three crowned magi/ standing/ bear gold gifts/ The eldest raises right forefinger before crowned Herod the Great/ With right hand on right knee and with left hand tugging cord of ermine-lined mantle/ he sits on throne/ Scene in architectural setting of triple arcade/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 20r
folio_text: 1) Innocents: Massacre -- Dark-faced soldier in hauberk/ wearing helmet/ with sword impales body of nude infant above him/ He stands beside nursing mother/ showing breasts/ with severed head of infant in her arms/ seated on ground/ Dark-faced man/ in tunic/ holds sword in right hand/ points to the soldier with his left hand/ and stands beside two decapitated infants/ He turns his head toward Herod/ crowned/ dark-faced/ raising his right forefinger at the man/ He sits on cushioned bench/ with devil perched on his shoulder/ Scene in architectural setting of triple arcade/2) Christ: Baptism -- John Baptist/ wearing mantle of skins/ holds vessel in draped left hand and raises right hand toward shoulder of Christ/ cross-nimbed/ with His right hand raised in blessing/ He stands nude in Jordan river in which are fishes and eel/ To right/ nimbed angel holds garment/ Scene in architectural setting of triple arcade/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 20v
folio_text: 1) Christ: Temptation/ 1st -- Bestial devil/ bearded/ with horns in elbow and shoulder/ and human mask with protruding tongue at genitals/ points with left hand to pile of stones below/ Devil raises right hand toward Christ/ cross-nimbed/ standing with right forefinger raised and holding book in draped left hand/Christ: Temptation/ 2nd -- To right/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ sits on mount/ holds book in draped left hand/ and raises right forefinger at bestial horned devil/ with eyes on thorax/ wings at elbows/ horns at knees/ and claws/ With right hand raised/ the devil points with left hand toward goods/ including drinking horn and vessels/ at base of the mount/2) Christ: Temptation/ 3rd -- Bestial devil/ with goat's horns on head/ horns at shoulders and elbows/ human mask at genitals/ and webbed right hand/ raises left forefinger at cross-nimbed Christ/ He raises right hand/ holds book in draped left hand/ and sits on top of domical temple/ Both flank goods of moneybag/ drinking horn/ goblet/ vessel/ and round object/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 21r
folio_text: 1) Christ: Parable/ Lazarus and Dives -- Nimbed angel emerges from cloud/ lifting nude soul of Lazarus with right palm of hand shown/ Below/ Lazarus/ wearing hooded mantle/ covered with leprous sores/ with right hand raised/ lies on ground/ beside staff/ purse/ and cap/Abraham: representing Paradise -- To right/ Abraham/ rayed nimbus/ white haired and bearded/ sits on throne/ holding orant nude soul of Lazarus in bosom/2) Christ: Parable/ Lazarus and Dives -- Dives/ nude/ lies in draped four-post bed/ From his mouth emerges nude soul ascending between horns of green bestial devil/ with fringed waist-bands/ grasping both the soul and Dives/ Chain around neck of the soul/ with hands joined/ is pulled by another bestial horned devil/ with fringed waist-bands/ departing to right/At right/ bestial devil (upper part green)/ wearing pointed cap and fringed waist-bands/ pushes down into flaming Hell Mouth Dives raising object in right hand toward his open mouth/ He raises left hand toward horned devil/ with horn at shoulder and face at genitals/ forcing him down with hook/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 21v
folio_text: 1) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Apostle/ holding book in draped left hand/ and Apostle Peter/ tonsured/ both stand behind Christ/ cross-nimbed/ with book in draped left hand/ He raises right hand in blessing toward Lazarus/ in brown shroud/ seated in sarcophagus/ in front of group of standing men/ One/ with right hand raised/ grasps with left hand Lazarus' right hand/ and another/ with his nostrils covered/ places his hands on Lazarus' shoulders/2) Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Three nimbed apostles/ including tonsured Peter/ follow Christ/ cross-nimbed/ raising right hand in blessing and holding reins with left hand/ mounted on ass treading on garment spread by youth/ Two men/ wearing hats/ hold palms and stand at city gate of Jerusalem/ above which are six men/ one grasping branch of tree/ and another bearded/ all behind crenellated wall/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 22r
folio_text: 1) Judas: receiving Silver -- Judas/ with coins in draped left hand/ extends right hand to right hand of one of two Jews; the other Jew grasps the draped left hand of Judas/ Man stands under right arch of triple arcade of architectural setting/2) Christ: Last Supper -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ extends in left hand sop toward Judas pointing with left hand toward his open mouth and kneeling in front of draped table set with two vessels/ knife/ and food/ Christ holds wafer-like bread on the table/ Flanking Him are two groups of nimbed apostles/ all behind the table/ One/ with head draped/ holds up portion/ Tonsured Peter touches His mantle/ Another/ with hand on food/ indicates another apostle holding up portion and pointing to the knife/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 22v
folio_text: 1) Christ: Washing of Feet -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ with towel around His shoulder/ lowers hands toward basin/ before Apostle Peter/ nimbed/ tonsured/ raising right hand to head and lifting right leg above the basin/ He sits beside ten nimbed apostles seated on bench; some gesture/2) Christ: Betrayal and Arrest/ and Apostle/ Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Two nimbed apostles stand behind Peter/ nimbed/ tonsured/ with left hand grasping Malchus' hair/ With sword in right hand/ he cuts off ear of Malchus/ dark-faced/ kneeling with joined hands raised/ Christ/ cross-nimbed/ is embraced by Judas/ Four dark-faced men hold clubs and swords; one raises lantern/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 23r
folio_text: 1) Christ: Resurrection -- Two flanking nimbed angels approach with joined hands raised toward Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing partly draped red mantle/ showing wounds/ With cross-staff in left hand/ He steps forward over transverse lid resting against sarcophagus decorated with arches/2) Holy Women: at Sepulcher -- Nimbed angel/ red-faced (red-skinned)/ sits on sarcophagus/ holds palm in left hand/ and points with left hand toward transverse lid/ in front of three veiled nimbed Holy Women holding ointment jars and gesturing/ In foreground/ four soldiers/ armed with spears and shields/ sleep/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 23v
folio_text: 1) Christ: Harrowing of Hell -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing mantle/ showing wounds/ holds bannered cross-staff in left hand and treads on prostrate horned Satan with arms bound/ With right hand/ He grasps left hand of Adam beside Eve/ both nude/ stepping from flaming Hell Mouth in which are five nude Damned/ including mitered bishop and crowned king/ Bestial devil behind the Hell Mouth/2) Christ: noli me tangere -- Beside tree/ Mary Magdalen/ nimbed/ veiled/ wearing vair-lined mantle/ partly kneels/ holds ointment jar in draped left hand/ and extends right hand toward standing cross-nimbed Christ/ He inclines His head toward her/ and holds scroll inscribed NOLI ME TANGERE from John 20:17/ in His right hand and book in His draped left hand/Scenes within decorated frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 24r
folio_text: 1) Stephen Protomartyr: Stoning -- One of three executioners holds stones in skirt of tunic; all raise stones above Stephen/ tonsured/ wearing priest's vestments with stole and maniple over joined hands raised/ He kneels beside Saul (Paul) seated amid foliage/ raising right hand toward the protomartyr/2) Lawrence of Rome: Scene/ Martyrdom -- Hand of God emerges from cloudy arc of heaven above two executioners/ one with forked implement and the other with grapnel/ prodding Lawrence/ nimbed/ tonsured/ nude on gridiron/ Man/ kneeling/ with bellows fans fire of sticks stirred by man holding rod/ Emperor Decius/ crowned/ sits on cushioned bench/ raising right hand and holding floreate scepter in left hand/3) Vincent of Saragossa: Scene/ Torture -- Hand of God emerges from cloudy arc of heaven above Vincent/ nimbed/ half nude/ bound to X-cross (saltire)/ attacked with grapnels by five executioners/ one kneeling/4) Hippolytus the Jailer: Scene/ Martyrdom -- Emperor Decius/ crowned/ sits on cushioned bench and holds scepter in left hand/ With right hand/ he indicates two horsemen/ one with scourge or whip/ dragging Hippolytus/ tonsured/ nude/ with feet bound and arms bound behind/Scenes within architectural frames/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 24v
folio_text: 1) Thomas ³l Becket: murdered before High Altar -- One of four soldiers/ in mail/ armed with swords/ strikes with sword tonsured head of Thomas with joined hands raised/ partly kneeling before draped altar/ Behind/ Grim the Chaplain/ tonsured/ holds processional cross in right hand and raises left hand/2) Edmund of England: Scene/ Martyrdom -- Edmund/ crowned/ in loin cloth/ stands with wrists bound to column/ flanked by four executioners with bows shooting arrows at him/3) Denis of Paris: Beheading/ and Denis of Paris: carrying Head -- Hand of God emerges from cloudy arc of heaven/ blessing Denis of Paris carrying his head/ He descends toward red portals of building from mount where/ again represented/ he kneels holding his head/ beside executioner holding sword in right hand and raising left forefinger/4) Albanus of Verulam: Scene/ Martyrdom -- Man gestures toward executioner seizing hair of Albanus and with sword beheading him/ Albanus partly kneels/ with joined hands raised/Scenes within architectural settings/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 25r
folio_text: 1) Apostle/ Peter: Crucifixion -- Four executioners with hammers affix Peter/ nimbed/ tonsured/ with four nails to cross upside down/2) Apostle/ Paul: Execution -- Hand of God emerges from arc of heaven above Apostle Paul/ nimbed/ bald/ kneeling with joined hands/ before Nero/ crowned/ seated on cushioned bench/ with crossed ankles on dais/ He holds sword in right hand and looks toward executioner grasping the apostle's head and raising sword/ beside Plautilla of Rome/ wearing long hair/ with right hand raised to breast/3) Apostle/ Andrew: Crucifixion -- Four executioners/ one on ladder/ all with ropes bound Andrew/ nimbed/ to X-cross (saltire)/4) Apostle/ James Major: Martyrdom -- Hand of God emerges from cloudy arc of heaven above executioner raising sword and grasping head of James Major kneeling with hands raised toward Herod Agrippas I/ crowned/ seated on cushioned bench/ He holds floreate scepter in right hand and raises left hand/ Devil hovers at his head/Scenes within architectural settings/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 25v
folio_text: 1) Evangelist/ John: Death/ John praying within the Grave -- Evangelist John/ nimbed/ lies in sarcophagus/ raising joined hands/ Two groups of nimbed apostles/ one holding book/ and Christ/ cross-nimbed/ holding nimbed/ nude soul of the Evangelist/ stand/2) Evangelist/ Matthew: Martyrdom -- One of six men raises left hand and with sword strikes head of Matthew/ nimbed/ in priest's vestment/ raising joined hands and standing before altar/ Dove of Holy Ghost emerges from arc of heaven/3) Apostle/ Simon: Martyrdom/ and Apostles/ Simon and Jude: Scene/ Idols of Samir -- One of six men saws head of Simon/ nimbed/ standing with right hand raised and book in draped left hand/ Above/ Hand of God emerges from arc of heaven/ blessing him/ At right/ sun and crescent moon appear above two horned bestial idols/ wearing fringed waist-bands/ standing on column/4) Apostle/ Bartholomew: Martyrdom -- Astyages/ crowned/ sits on bench/ holds sword in right hand/ and raises left hand toward Hand of God emerging from cloudy arc of heaven/ above nude Bartholomew/ He is flayed with knives by four executioners/Scenes within architectural settings/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 26r
folio_text: 1) Martin of Tours: dividing Cloak -- Martin/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter with infulae/ mounted on bridled horse/ with sword divides cloak grasped by half nude beggar/2) Nicholas of Myra: Scene/ Three Youths rescued from Barrel -- Nicholas/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter and vestments/ holds crozier in left/ He extends right hand toward three nude youths in barrel in front of innkeeper with his hands raised and his veiled wife/3) and 4) Benedict of Montecassino: Scene/ Placidus saved by Maurus -- Benedict/ with crozier in left hand/ and Maurus of Glanfeuil/ with right hand raised/ wear cowled habits/ Both depart and point to right/ Maurus/ in cowled habit/ walks on water of lake/ grasping hood of Placidus of Sicily/ tonsured/ in habit/ holding pitcher/ partially submerged in water/Scenes within architectural settings/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 26v
folio_text: 1) Holy Women -- Three Holy Women/ nimbed/ veiled/ stand/ holding ointment jars/2) Mary Magdalen: Scene/ addressing Group of Men (preaching) -- Mary Magdalen/ nimbed/ with long hair/ wearing mantle over left shoulder only/ raises right forefinger toward palm of left hand/ She stands before three tonsured men/ two seated on cushioned bench/3) and 4) Catherine of Alexandria: Martyrdom (?) -- Maxentius/ crowned/ sits on cushioned bench/ holds floreate scepter in left hand/ With right hand/ he directs executioner raising sword and grasping hair of Catherine of Alexandria/ nimbed/ kneeling with hands raised/Scenes within architectural settings/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 27v
folio_text: Psalm 001 (Vulg// 001)Initial B:1) Jesse: Tree -- Jesse/ scalloped nimbus/ reclines sleeping with left hand to face on draped bed/ With right hand/ he supports branches enclosing four seated figures as follows:David as musician/ crowned/ plays harp; Solomon/ crowned/ holds sword; Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ crowned/ holds book; and Christ/ cross-nimbed/ raises right hand in blessing and holds book in left hand on left knee/ All are flanked by Moses with Tables of Law and thirteen Prophets/ all nimbed/ as three-quarter to half figures/ some holding scrolls or books/ and some gesturing/Tree of Jesse within initial B decorated with foliate and interlace ornament/Medallion/ at center of vertical bar of initial B:David as Musician -- David/ seated on bench/ plays harp/Frame/ top:2) Apostle Peter holds two keys in left hand and extends right hand toward apostle/ with right hand raised and book in left hand; both/ nimbed/ sit/ within elliptical medallion/3) Virgin Mary: Coronation -- Christ/ decorated crossed nimbus/ holds book in left hand and with right hand crowns Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ orant; both sit on bench/ within elliptical medallion/ They are flanked by two nimbed seraphim/ within medallions/ and by half figures of four nimbed angels with joined hands raised/ turned toward the couple/4) Apostle/ with book in left hand/ extends right hand toward Apostle Paul with sword in right hand and left hand raised/ seated; both/ nimbed/ within elliptical medallion/Frame/ left:5) Evangelist John and apostle/ both nimbed/ hold books/ within elliptical medallion at center/ Above and below/ two nimbed seraphim in elliptical medallions; above/ half figures of three mitered bishops/ and below/ half figures of six tonsured clerics/ all representing the Elect/Frame/ right:6) Two nimbed apostles/ holding books/ sit within elliptical medallion at center/ Above and below/ two nimbed seraphim in elliptical medallions; above/ half figures of three crowned kings and three tonsured clerics/ and below/ half figures of crowned queens/ and women/ all representing the Elect/Frame/ bottom:7) and 8) Two pairs of nimbed apostles/ seated/ gesture toward another; three hold books; each pair in elliptical medallion/9) Christ: Last Judgment -- Four of five nude Damned in flames within bestial devil/ grasping the prostrate fifth in its mouth/ all within elliptical medallion/ They are flanked by two nimbed angels blowing trumpets/ and by two bestial devils with grapnels attacking nude man and woman/ each in sarcophagus/ within medallion/Patterned background/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 28r
folio_text: Full page of incipit from Psalm 1:1/ displayed in gold on colored backgrounds/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 28v
folio_text: Psalm 002 (Vulg// 002) -- Male figure/ in tunic/ wrestles with animal/ standing on hind legs/ both within initial Q with its tail formed by fantastic animal biting fish/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 29v
folio_text: Psalm 004 (Vulg// 004) -- Three-quarter figure of man raising joined hands/ within initial C/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 32r
folio_text: Psalm 007 (Vulg// 007) -- Three-quarter figure of Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised in blessing and book in left hand on left hand/ seated/ within initial D/ Its ascender is formed by dragon biting tail of horned bestial devil playing viol/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 38r
folio_text: Psalm 013 (Vulg// 012) -- Half figure of Christ-Logos/ with right hand raised in blessing and with book in left hand on left knee/ seated/ within initial U formed partly by animal head biting upright animal/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 38v
folio_text: Psalm 014 (Vulg// 013) -- Half figure of partly nude fool with blue head and grotesque features/ wearing fringed waist-band/ gesturing/ within initial D/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 43r
folio_text: Psalm 018: (Vulg// 017:26) -- Three-quarter figure of nimbed saint or prophet/ white-haired and bearded/ with right hand raised and book in draped left hand/ within initial C/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 47r
folio_text: Psalm 022 (Vulg// 021) -- Half figure of Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised in blessing and book in left hand/ within initial D/ with its ascender formed by dragon biting fish/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 48r
folio_text: Line endings decorated with fish/ fantastic animal/ and hybrid of two confronted bird bodies sharing one human head/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 50r
folio_text: Psalm 024 (Vulg// 023) -- Youth/ armed with shield/ thrusts spear into upright animal/ within initial D/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 54r
folio_text: Psalm 029 (Vulg// 028) -- Animal/ bird/ and seated male figure/ in white garment/ with spear attack dragon/ forming with fish part of initial A/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 67r
folio_text: Psalm 038 (Vulg// 037) -- Half figure of Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised in blessing and book in left hand on left knee/ seated/ within initial D decorated wtih foliate terminal/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 71v
folio_text: Psalm 042 (Vulg// 041) -- Three-faced male musician/ seated/ holds fiddle/ within initial Q/ with its tail of foliate ornament pulled by grimacing man/ in left margin/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 73r
folio_text: Psalm 044 (Vulg// 043) -- Half figure of Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised and book in left hand/ on left knee/ seated within initial D with ascender of foliate ornament/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 77v
folio_text: Psalm 048 (Vulg// 047) -- Two men/ in tunics/ battle with shields and weapons/ within initial M/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 79v
folio_text: Psalm 050 (Vulg// 049) -- Two men/ in tunics/ wrestle; shields on ground; figures within initial D/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 81r
folio_text: Psalm 051 (Vulg// 050) -- Three-quarter figure of Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised in blessing and book in left hand/ He is flanked by man and woman/ wearing berbette/ both wearing vair-lined mantles/ as donors/ kneeling with joined hands raised toward Him/ Figures within initial M with descender terminated by hooded human head/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 94v
folio_text: Psalm 068 (Vulg// 067) -- Nimbed angel holding scroll/ seated behind horizontal bar of initial E/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 97r
folio_text: Psalm 069 (Vulg// 068)/1) Jonah: cast overboard -- In sailboat with bird prows/ two men/ one hooded/ throw Jonah/ hooded/ into mouth of whale in sea/2) Jonah: cast up -- Jonah/ hooded/ with left hand to face/ sits on whale on sea/Scenes within initial S against gold background (abraded)/ within decorated frame edged with green/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 98r
folio_text: Bust of bearded/ long-haired man/ sketched in margin/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 106v
folio_text: Psalm 075 (Vulg// 074) -- Nimbed male saint or prophet/ with right hand raised/ seated on cushioned bench/ within initial C/

tomb_text: PsalterEngland/ Oxford/ between 1212 and 1220MS M/43 fol/ 156r
folio_text: Psalm 110 (Vulg// 109) -- Christ-Logos/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised in blessing and book in left hand on left knee/ seated on cushioned bench/ within mandorla/ in initial D decorated with foliate dragon ascender/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 1v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Archangel Gabriel/ decorated nimbus/ extends right hand toward Virgin Mary/ decorated nimbus/ veiled/ with her hands raised/ Both stand/ Dove of Holy Ghost descends toward her head/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 2r
folio_text: Christ: Nativity -- Joseph the Carpenter/ wearing cap/ sits with his head resting on left hand/ behind Virgin Mary/ veiled/ reclining on mattress (?)/Below/ angel/ decorated nimbus/ descends from right toward Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ swaddled/ in manger before ass and ox; fence in background/ Lamp is suspended between looped curtains/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 2v
folio_text: Shepherds: Annunciation -- Two angels descend from clouds toward three shepherds/ Two wear hooded garments/One plays pipe/ seated on ground/ and the second/ with pipes suspended from cord around neck/ holds pedum in his right hand and raises his left hand/The third/ wearing cape of skins/ holds horn in his right hand and pedum in his left hand/ All tend goats/ sheep/ and oxen/Scene against gold background/within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 3r
folio_text: Christ: Flight into Egypt -- Nimbed angel/ swinging censer/ descends toward Joseph the Carpenter/ wearing cap/ with staff in his left hand/In his right hand/ he holds bridle of ass on which Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ rides sideways in saddle/ holding Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ seated on her lap/ raising His right hand toward Joseph and turning His head toward the Virgin/At left/ youth/ possibly James/ Son of Joseph/ carries cask suspended from staff in his left hand and scourge (goad) in right hand/ Three trees/ Scene beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 3v
folio_text: Christ: Presentation -- Anna/ Prophetess/ nimbed/ veiled/ carries two doves in basket/ beside Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ holding Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ with His right hand raised/ above draped altar/ To right/ Simeon/ barefoot/ extends his hands toward the Child/Scene beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ within decorated frame/ including four human heads in square corners/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 4r
folio_text: Magi: before Herod the Great -- Three crowned Magi/ nimbed/ including two with rods/ one beardless/ all stand before Herod the Great/ crowned/ pearled nimbus/ pulling beard/ seated with legs crossed on animal faldstool/Scene beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 4v
folio_text: Magi: Adoration -- Three magi/ two crowned and nimbed/ one beardless/ hold vessels/ The eldest/ with crown in his left hand/ kneels presenting round object to left hand of Christ Child/ decorated crossed nimbus/ raising His right hand in blessing/ seated on lap of Mary/ nimbed/ crowned/ veiled/ seated on bench/ Star of Bethlehem in central spandrel of architectural frame/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 5r
folio_text: Christ: Baptism -- Dove of Holy Ghost descends from clouds toward head of Christ/ cross-nimbed/ nude/ in river Jordan/ in which are three fishes/ To left/ John Baptist/ wearing mantle of skins/ raises his hands toward the Christ; to right/ nimbed angel holds garment/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 5v
folio_text: Christ: Temptation -- Bestial horned devil drops six stones before Christ/ cross-nimbed/ raising His right forefinger toward the devil/ He holds book under His left arm/ Above to right/ half figure of nimbed angel swinging censer/ Tree in center/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 6r
folio_text: Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Five apostles/ four nimbed/ two with palm branches/ all follow behind Christ/ cross-nimbed/ holding palm branch in His left hand/With His right hand raised in blessing/ He is seated astride draped ass approaching city gate of Jerusalem in which are five men/ four with branches/ and one with sickle about to cut palm branch/Before the city gate/ one of two men holds branches/ and the other spreads garment on ground/Scene within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 6v
folio_text: Christ: Last Supper -- Christ/ decorated crossed nimbus/ stands (?)/ raising wafer in His right hand and chalice in His left hand/ In front of the Christ/ Evangelist John/ nimbed/ rests his head on his left hand/ Ten flanking apostles/ seven nimbed/ sit at draped table laden with vessels/ vase/ and food; one holds knife/ In foreground/ Judas/ nimbed/ holding vessel/ kneels before the table/Scene beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ within decorated frame/ and heads of four women in square corners/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 7r
folio_text: Christ: Washing of Feet -- Eleven nimbed apostles/ one seated (?)/ flank Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing apron/ He kneels beside basin/ raising His right hand in blessing/ and with left hand grasping right foot of Peter/ holding his right hand to his head/ seated on bench/Scene against gold background/ within frame decorated with foliate ornament and four medallions enclosing birds/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 7v
folio_text: Christ: Betrayal and Arrest/ and Apostle/ Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Judas/ nimbed/ embraces Christ/ cross-nimbed/ extending His right hand toward Peter/ nimbed/ with sword in right hand cutting off ear of Malchus partly kneeling/Eight soldiers/ in mail/ armed with four spears/ lantern and sword/ flank the Christ; one grasps His shoulder/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 8r
folio_text: Christ: crowned with Thorns -- Christ/ nimbed/ holds green reed (hyssop ?) in His right hand/ He is flanked by four men/ two wearing caps// One places crown on His head/ and three raise their hands/ mocking Him/Scene against gold background/ within frame decorated with foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 8v
folio_text: Christ: Flagellation -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ in long loin cloth/ stands bound with wrists to column/ He is flanked by two men/ one raising switches/ and the other raising scourge/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 9r
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross -- Among four men/ one/ wearing pointed cap/ holds hammer in his right hand and three nails in his draped left hand; one holds rod; and the other two grasp Christ/ cross-nimbed/ bearing on His right shoulder green cross with flared top and arms/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 9v
folio_text: Christ: Crucifixion -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ head inclined/ eyes closed/ in long loin cloth/ is affixed with four nails to green cross with flared top and arms/He is flanked by Virgin Mary/ veiled/ with her raised hands clasped/ and John with his right hand raised to his face; both are nimbed/Above arms of the cross/ Personifications of Sun/ rays encircling head/ and Moon/ veiled/ with crescent on head/ emerge from clouds/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 10r
folio_text: Christ: Deposition -- Joseph of Arimathea/ bearded/ wearing fillet/ with draped hands supports body of Christ/ cross-nimbed/ in long loin cloth/ They are flanked by Virgin Mary/ veiled/ and Evangelist John/ both nimbed/ holding arms of the Christ/ detached from green cross with flared top and arms/ Nicodemus/ bearded/ kneels with pincers in left hand/ detaching one of two nails fastening feet of the Christ to the cross/ He raises his right hand to hem of the loin cloth and glances toward the Christ/ Above/ two angels/ one nimbed/ emerge from clouds/ swinging censers/Scene against gold background/ within frame decorated with foliate ornament and semicircles/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 10v
folio_text: Christ: Entombment -- Man and Nicodemus/ both wearing caps/ lower body of Christ/ partially wrapped in shroud/ into architectural sarcophagus behind which is Joseph of Arimathea/ wearing fillet/ pouring ointment from vessel on Him/Scene beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ within frame decorated with foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 11r
folio_text: Holy Women: at Sepulcher -- Angel/ nimbed/ holds cross-staff in left hand/ extends right hand/ and sits (?) behind sarcophagus draped with grave clothes/Among three nimbed Holy Women/ one/ with hooded garment/ points with left hand to the clothes; two are veiled; two hold ointment jars/In foreground/ three soldiers/ in mail/ armed with two shields and two spears/ sleep in front of the sarcophagus/Scene beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 11v
folio_text: Christ: Harrowing of Hell -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ crowned/ tramples on recumbent horned devil (Satan) and with His right hand thrusts cross-staff into his jaws/ With His left hand/ He grasps Adam/ nude/ beside nude tonsured cleric/ both before Hell Mouth in which are five figures/ accompanied by devil at top/Above/ angel/ swinging censer/ descends from clouds/ In foreground are three figures of Damned/ two nude/ one seated/ and the third prostrate/ with extended hands/ amid flames/Scene against gold background/ within frame decorated with foliate ornament and four human heads in corner squares/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 12r
folio_text: Christ: noli me tangere -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ holds cross-staff in His left hand and raises His right hand in blessing toward Mary Magdalen/ nimbed/ veiled/ kneeling/ with her joined hands raised; tree/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 12v
folio_text: Apostle/ Thomas: Incredulity -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ raises His left arm/ revealing wound in opening of His garment on His left side/His right hand is grasped by Thomas/ nimbed/ kneeling partly and extending his right forefinger to the side wound of Christ/Three nimbed apostles/ one with joined hands raised/ stand at right/Scene with decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 13r
folio_text: Christ: constrained to stay at Emmaus -- Christ/ pearled crossed nimbus/ wearing pilgrim's hat/ holds staff in His left hand/ He is flanked by two disciples wearing pilgrims' hats and holding staves/ One raises his right hand toward His shoulder/ and the other grasps His right hand/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 13v
folio_text: Christ: Supper at Emmaus -- Christ/ pearled crossed nimbus/ wearing pilgrim's hat/ raises half loaf in each hand/ He is flanked by two disciples/ wearing pilgrims' hats/ One grasps His left arm/ All sit on benches behind table on which are fishes in vessels/ round loaf/ and knife/Scene/ beneath architectural frame/ against gold background/ with decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 14r
folio_text: Christ: Ascension -- Christ disappears into cloudy arc of heaven/ with only legs visible/ above Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ orant/ flanked by twelve apostles/ eight nimbed/ all standing/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 14v
folio_text: Pentecost -- Within half elliptical medallion or mandorla/ dove of Holy Ghost descends/ issuing red rays from its beak on heads of twelve apostles/ eight nimbed/ five with books/ all seated/Scene with decorated frame and human heads in corner squares/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 15r
folio_text: Christ: Last Judgment -- Two nimbed angels/ blowing curved horns/ emerge from clouds above Christ/ cross-nimbed/ wearing mantle/ revealing His torso and showing wounds/He raises His arms (orant) and sits on cushioned bench/ behind green cross with flared ends/He is flanked by heads of eighteen figures/ possibly the Elect/ Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ and John Baptist/ nimbed/ both kneeling (Deesis ?)/ and half figures of two angels blowing curved horns/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 15v
folio_text: Christ: Last Judgment -- Christ/ cross-nimbed/ raises His right hand in blessing/ holds open book in His left hand/ and sits on bench/He is flanked by two standing seraphim with peacock wings/ and two nimbed figures/ possibly wingless angels/ kneeling/ one holding crown/ and the other holding spear or nails (Instruments of Passion)/

tomb_text: Vita Christi (Life of Christ)France/ perhaps Corbie/ ca/ 1175MS M/44 fol/ 16r
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Coronation -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ kneels (?) with joined hands raised toward Christ/ nimbed/ crowned/ with book in His left hand/ seated on cushioned bench/ placing crown on head of Virgin Mary/ Both are in mandorla/ supported by four angels/ one nimbed/ all as half figures/Scene against gold background/ within decorated frame/

tomb_text: The Crucifixion and St/ LeonardGermany/ 1457MS M/45 fol/ 1v
folio_text: Miniature:Christ: Crucifixion -- Christ/ cross nimbed/ eyes closed/ with crown of thorns/ and wearing short loin cloth/ is affixed with three nails to cross bearing titulus INRI/ He is flanked by Virgin Mary/ nimbed and veiled/ head bowed/ hands joined at breast and by Evangelist John/ nimbed/ orant/ wearing small bag on belt at waist/ All are against background of gold stamped with oak leaves and acorns/Floreate border containing leafy vine with flowers/ squirrel and bullfinch/ all within frame bearing inscription ASPICE MORTALIS FUIT UNQUAM PASSIO TALIS PECCATUM SPERNE PRO QUO MEA WLNERA CERNE ASPICE QUI TRANSIS QUIA TU MICHI CAUSA DOLORIS UT VIVAS MORIOR NON EST DILECCIO MAIOR ARTIFEX IOHANNES BEMLER 1457/Corners:1) In quatrefoil/ bust of saint/ possibly/ Apostle Peter/ nimbed/ right hand at breast/ holding open book in draped left hand/ against gold background/2) In medallion/ against gold background/ kneeling male figure/ possibly symbol for Evangelist Matthew/ holding scroll/3) In quatrefoil/ against gold background/ bust of bishop or abbot/ wearing miter/ holding crozier in right hand and closed book in draped left hand/4) In medallion/ against gold background/ winged lion (?) with scroll/ possibly symbol for Evangelist Mark/

tomb_text: The Crucifixion and St/ LeonardGermany/ 1457MS M/45 fol/ 2r
folio_text: Miniature:Leonard of Limoges: Scene/ delivering Prisoners -- Two men emerge from door of prison/ the foremost/ his arms raised/ with chain around right ankle/ his right wrist grasped by right hand of Leonard/ nimbed and tonsured/ wearing black robe over gold undergarment/ His nimbus is inscribed O SANCT LEONARDE ORA PRO NOBISScene against gold background stamped with flowers/ with grass and flowers on the earth/Border:Floreate ornament including roses and columbine; animals/ including rabbit/ monkeys/ one holding object/ bear/ and bullfinch/ all within frame bearing inscription O LEONARDE MIRIFICE QUI SOLES VINCTOS SOLVERE A FERREIS COMPEDIBUS SOLVE NOS TUIS PRECIBUS A PECCATORUM VINCULIS ET A CUNCTIS PERICULIS ORA PRO FRATRIBUS TUIS BEATE LEONHARDE PATER MISERICORDIE/Corners:1) In medallion/ eagle with scroll/ probably symbol for Evangelist/ John/2) In quatrefoil/ cardinal/ holding object in right hand and model of church in draped left hand/3) In medallion/ ox/ winged/ with scroll/ probably symbol for Evangelist/ Luke/4) In quatrefoil/ bishop or abbot/ wearing miter/ holding book in right hand and staff (?) in left hand/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 7v
folio_text: Trinity: Mercy Seat -- God/ with crossed nimbus/ seated on draped bench/ with both hands supports cross with titulus inscribed INRI/ to which is affixed with three nails Christ/ with crossed nimbus/ wearing short loin cloth/ bleeding from wounds/ Beside Christ is dove of Holy Ghost/ Above is arc of heaven/ Diapered background/Margins with diaper pattern/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 12v
folio_text: Margaret of Antioch: Scene/ emerging from Dragon -- Margaret/ nimbed/ wearing fillet (?)/ with joined hands raised/ emerges from back of single-horned dragon/ with the hem of her mantle hanging from its mouth/ Diapered background/ Quatrefoils at corners of miniature/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 15v
folio_text: Edward the Confessor (?)/ nimbed/ crowned/ wearing ermine-lined mantle inscribed with fleur-de-lis and gown with hem inscribed S[ANCTUS] ED///S/ stands before low wall with arched leaded-glass windows and holds scepter in left hand and book in right hand/ Foliate background/Margins with diaper ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 17v
folio_text: John Baptist/ nimbed/ standing/ with right hand indicates Lamb of God/ nimbed/ laying on book with two clasps held in John's left hand/ Figure in wilderness with rocks and trees/Margins with diaper ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 19v
folio_text: Mary Magdalen/ with scalloped nimbus/ stands and holds ointment jar/ Diaper background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 21v
folio_text: Evangelist John/ with scalloped nimbus/ standing before low wall/ with right hand indicates goblet with dragon held in left hand/ Diapered background with fleur-de-lis/ Arc of Heaven (?) in upper corners/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 23v
folio_text: Christopher of Lycia: carrying Christ Child -- Christopher/ nimbed/ holding staff in both hands/ standing in stream/ carries on his shoulders Christ Child/ cross-nimbed/ with right hand raised and holding tripartite globe in left hand/ Two ducks float in stream/ In background is hermit/ holding staff in left hand and in right hand lantern/ emanating rays/ In distance are ship/ cross-surmounted church (?) spires/ and windmill on hill/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 25v
folio_text: Thomas ³l Becket: murdered before High Altar -- Helmeted soldier/ holding saber raised in both hands/ stands behind man/ wearing hat/ with sword at waist/ raising in right hand dagger above head of Thomas ³l Becket/ nimbed/ tonsured/ wearing priest's vestments and stole/ bleeding from wound in head/ kneeling with joined hands raised before draped/ curtained altar/ upon which are book with two clasps/ chalice/ and lighted candle/ Before retable is vision (?) of Virgin Mary/ crowned/ emanating rays/ holding nude infant Christ Child/ Diaper background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 27v
folio_text: George of Cappadocia: slaying Dragon -- George/ nimbed/ wearing helmet and armor/ seated astride horse with trappings with heraldic arms of George/ raises sword in right hand above dragon/ fallen to ground/ impaled by broken lance through its mouth/ Princess of Trebizond/ crowned/ with hands raised/ witnesses scene/ Scene in landscape with two trees/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 29v
folio_text: Barbara of Nicomedia/ nimbed/ stands before low wall with arched leaded-glass windows and holds tower in right arm/ Diaper background/ Quatrefoils at corners of miniature/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 31v
folio_text: Catherine of Alexandria/ with rayed nimbus/ with right hand on wheel and with left hand on sword/ stands before low wall/ Gold scroll background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 33v
folio_text: Gatianus of Tours/ nimbed/ wearing bishop's miter/ holding crozier in right hand and book with two clasps in left hand/ stands before low wall with blind arcade/ Background with foliate ornament/ Arc of Heaven (?) above/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 35v
folio_text: Albanus of Verulam/ nimbed/ wearing hat with decorated band and ermine-lined mantle with collar inscribed S ALBAN/ holding book with two clasps in right hand and double-armed cross in left hand/ stands before low wall with arcade/ Diaper background/Margins with diaper ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 37v
folio_text: Seraph/ with arms extended (orant)/ standing on wheel/ Beside him stands male donor/ with joined hands raised/ emanating rays/ Gold scroll background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 44v
folio_text: Erkenwaldus of London/ with rayed nimbus/ wearing bishop's miter and vestments/ stands and with right hand indicates crozier held in left hand/ Diaper background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 45v
folio_text: Aetheldreda of Ely/ with rayed nimbus/ veiled/ stands and holds book with two clasps in right hand and crozier in left hand/ Gold scroll background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 47v
folio_text: Virgin Mary: Annunciation -- Archangel Gabriel/ with right hand indicating scroll inscribed AUE GRATIA PLENA DOMINUS TECUM/ held in left hand/ kneels on one knee before Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ kneeling at draped prie-dieu with open book with pseudo-inscription beneath canopy/ Vase of lilies is before the prie-dieu/ God/ with crossed nimbus/ in arc of heaven/ emits rays upon which descends dove of Holy Ghost to Virgin Mary/ Diaper background/Margins with diaper ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 53v
folio_text: Christ: in Gethsemane -- Apostles John and Peter/ tonsured/ both seated/ and James/ reclining with book on ground/ all nimbed/ all sleep with eyes closed beside Christ/ with crossed rays as nimbus/ kneeling with joined hands raised to God/ in arc of heaven/ emanating rays/ above goblet with wafer (host)/ Scene in fenced garden with stream/ trees/ and flowers/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 64v
folio_text: Christ: Betrayal and Arrest/ and Apostle/ Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Christ/ with rays as nimbus/ is embraced by Judas/ Around them stand helmeted soldiers with spears and swords/ To right is Peter/ nimbed/ tonsured/ holding raised sword in right hand above Malchus/ bleeding from ear/ lunging on ground beside club and lantern/ Trees and hills in background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 68v
folio_text: Christ: before Pilate -- Christ/ with bound draped hands/ surrounded by helmeted soldiers with spears/ stands before Pilate/ wearing hat and ermine-trimmed mantle/ seated on canopied throne/ holding scepter in left hand and gesturing toward Christ with right hand/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 71v
folio_text: Christ: bearing Cross -- Christ/ with rays as nimbus/ wearing crown of thorns/ bleeding from head/ carries on right shoulder tau cross/ Behind him walk Evangelist John (?) and Virgin Mary/ veiled/ with stars on her head and her shoulder/ holding arm of cross/ Helmeted soldier follows them/ Before Christ walk three men/ including soldier/ wearing armor/ and man/ wearing hat/ holding ends of rope tied around waist of Christ/ Scene in landscape with trees and hills/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 74v
folio_text: Christ: Crucifixion -- Christ/ with crossed nimbus/ wearing short loin cloth and crown of thorns/ bleeding from wounds in hands/ feet/ and side/ is affixed with three nails to cross with titulus inscribed INRI/ The cross is flanked by Virgin Mary/ veiled/ with joined hands raised/ and Evangelist John/ with hands raised/ both nimbed/ Bones on ground/ Above/ in arc of heaven/ is God/ with crossed nimbus/ emanating rays/ Diaper background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/ inhabited by five angels holding Instruments of the Passion/ including hammer and nails/ ladder/ column/ spear/ and sponge on rod/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 77v
folio_text: Christ: Deposition -- Joseph of Arimathea/ wearing turban-like headdress/ with purse at waist/ with draped hands supports Christ/ with rays as nimbus/ wearing short loin cloth and crown of thorns/ bleeding from wounds/ taken down from cross by Nicodemus (?)/ removing nail from left hand of Christ with pincers/ Virgin Mary/ veiled/ with stars on her head and shoulder/ holds right hand of Christ to her mouth/ Behind her stands Evangelist John/ Man kneels at base of cross with draped hands/ Scene in landscape with trees and flowers/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 80v
folio_text: Christ: Entombment -- Body of Christ/ wearing short loin cloth/ is lowered into carved sarcophagus by Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus/ both with draped hands/ Beside the sarcophagus stand three Holy Women/ two veiled/ all nimbed and holding ointment jars/ Scene in landscape with hills and trees/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 85v
folio_text: Virgin Mary and Christ Child: Type/ Apocalyptic Woman -- Virgin Mary/ with star-inscribed nimbus/ emanating rays/ with feet on crescent moon/ holds in her lap nude infant Christ Child/ nimbed/ all enclosed in mandorla/ with faces of angels (?) at corners/Margins with diaper ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 99v
folio_text: Christ: Last Judgment -- Two angels/ as half figures/ one inscribed MISERICORDIA and holding lily/ and the other inscribed IUSTINA and holding raised sword/ hold open mantle of Christ/ with crossed nimbus/ wearing crown of thorns/ showing bleeding wounds/ as half figure in clouds surmounting tripartite globe (as Man of Sorrows ?)/ Above is arc of heaven/ and below are three souls emerging from graves/ Diaper background/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/ inhabited by two angels/ both playing horns from which extend scrolls/ one inscribed SURGITE MORTUI VENITE AD IUDICIUM NUNC MANIFESTABUNTUR SECRETA CORDIUM/ and the other inscribed UNIVUIQUIS IUXTA PERA LARGIETUR PREMIUM IUSTUS DOMINUS IUSTUM IUDICUM/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 103v
folio_text: Heraldry/ Decorated: Instruments of Passion -- Angel/ nimbed/ sits supporting escutcheon decorated with instruments of the passion/ including hammer/ nails/ pincers/ lantern/ hand/ dice/ spear/ sponge on rod/ bucket/ column/ ladder/ and scourges/ Diaper background/ Quatrefoils at corners of miniature/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 119v
folio_text: Scene/ Liturgical: Obsequies -- Two hooded mourners/ holding rosaries/ sit beside bier draped in cross-inscribed pall/ with two lighted candles on candlesticks/ Behind the bier stand two tonsured priests/ holding open book/ and a third tonsured priest/ gesturing/ standing beside acolyte holding open book with pseudo-inscription/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 148v
folio_text: Christ: Piet³l -- Virgin Mary/ nimbed/ veiled/ holds in her lap nude body of Christ/ nimbed/ wearing crown of thorns/ bleeding from wounds/ with eyes closed/ Behind Mary is cross with titulus inscribed INRI/ Diaper background/ Quatrefoils at corners of miniature/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Book of HoursBelgium/ perhaps Ghent; England/ ca/ 1420MS M/46 fol/ 156v
folio_text: Jerome: Scene/ removing Thorn from Lion's Paw -- Jerome/ nimbed/ wearing cardinal's vestments and hat/ seated on canopied chair/ with knife removes thorn from right forepaw of lion/ standing on its hind legs with its forepaws in Jerome's lap/ Beside Jerome is writing desk with scroll with pseudo-inscription/ book with two clasps/ and stylus case/ Diaper background/ Quatrefoils at corners of miniature/Margins with ivy-rinceaux and foliate ornament/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 1r
folio_text: 1) Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover sleeping -- Lover/ with head on pillow/ bare-breasted/ sleeps on draped bed beside rose bush/ Scene with gold background/2) Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover dressing -- Lover sits on bench with legs crossed/ beside basin on stand below vessel suspended from rod over which cloth hangs/ Scene with patterned background/3) Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover walking -- Lover walks between two trees in which are birds/ including one owl/ both trees on hilllocks from which streams flow/ Scene with patterned background/4) Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover approaching Garden -- Lover/ holding object with right hand and with left hand raised/ stands before crenellated tower in which are three standing images of Personifications in windows/ Scene with diapered background/All scenes within tricolored (red/ white/ and blue) barbed quatrefoil frames/Below miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CE EST LI ROMANS DE LA ROSE OU LART DAMOURS EST TOUTE ENCLOSE/Below miniature in left column/ champide initial M of Maintes decorated with ivy foliate ornament/ as incipit of text/ MAINTES GENS DIENT QUE EN SONGES / N’A SE FABLES NON ET MENCONGES/Below miniature in right column/ champide initial D of De decorated with ivy foliate ornament/ at beginning of text/ DE CROIRE QUE SONGES AUIEGNE / QUI SE VOUDRA POR FOL ME TIEGNE/Margins surrounding text by rectilinear bars with ivy leaves/ forming five medallions enclosing busts of hooded man/ monkey/ two bishops wearing miters/ and cardinal wearing red hat/ inhabited by dragon in left margin (partly visible)/ two birds and insect in right margin/ and by rabbit pursued by dog and another dog and huntsman with horn and club in lower margin (bas-de-page)/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 2r
folio_text: 1) Roman de la Rose: Hate -- Personification of Hate/ name twice inscribed HAINE in rubric/ wearing draped headdress/ sits on bench/ grasps her head in profile with both hands/Figure against diapered background decorated with fleur-de-lis and within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/In bottom left column/ rubric label/ HAINE/Below miniature/ champide initial T decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ TR(E)S OU LE MILIEU UI HAINE / QUI DE COUROUS ET D’ATAINE/2) Roman de la Rose: Villainy -- Personification of Villainy/ name inscribed VILONNIE in rubric/ wearing hood/ sits in profile on bench decorated with quatrefoil oculus enclosing foliage/ her mouth opened/ possibly spitting into bowl held with both hands/Figure against patterned background within frame of blue miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature/ rubric label/ VILONNIE/Below miniature/ champide initial A decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ APPELLEE ESTOIT UILONNIE / UNE YMAGE QUI FELON(N)IE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 2v
folio_text: 1) Roman de la Rose: Covetousness -- Below rod over which two garments are draped/ woman/ representing Personification of Covetousness/ name inscribed COUUOITISE in rubric/ sits on bench/ extends right hand to goblet on chest and holds moneybag with left hand beside another chest containing coins/Figure against diapered background within frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric label/ COUUOITISE/Below miniature/ champide initial A of Apres decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ APRES FU PAINTE COUUOITISE / C’EST CELE QUI LES GENS ATISE/2) Roman de la Rose: Avarice -- Below rod over which vair mantle and garment are draped/ Personification of Avarice/ name inscribed AUARICE in rubric/ wearing wimpled-veil and ragged garment with patches/ holds moneybag and sits on bench/Figure against diapered background within frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric label/ AUARICE/Below miniature/ champide initial U of Une decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ UNE AUTRE YMAGE Y OT ASSISE / TOUT EN COSTE COUUOITISE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 3r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Envy -- Personification of Envy/ name inscribed ENUIE in rubric/ wearing bicolored draped hat in red and white/ sits on bench/ raises her right hand to her face/ and extends her left arm/Figure against diapered background decorated with fleur-de-lis within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature/ rubric label/ ENUIE/In right column/ champide initial A of Apres decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ AP(RE)S REFU P(O)URTRAITE ENUIE / QUI NE RIST ONQ(UE)S EN SA UIE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 3v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Sadness -- Personification of Sadness/ name inscribed TRISTESCE in rubric/ wearing veil/ stands and with her hands pulls tresses of her long hair/Figure against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature/ rubric label/ TRISTESCE/Below miniature/ champide initial D of De decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ DE LES E(N)UIE AUQ(UE)S P(RE)S IERE / TRISTESCE PAI(N)TE E(N) LA MAISIERE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 4r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Old Age -- Man representing Personification of Old Age/ name inscribed VIELLESCE in rubric/ white-bearded/ wearing hood with wimple/ walks/ leaning on crutches/Figure against diapered background decorated with fleur-de-lis within frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric label/ VIELLESCE/Below miniature/ champide initial A of Apres decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ AP(RE)S FU UIELLESCE POURT(RE)ITE / Q(UI) ESTOIT BIEN I PIE RET(RE)ITE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 4v
folio_text: 1) Roman de la Rose: Hypocrisy -- Personification of Hypocrisy/ name inscribed PAPELARDIE in rubric/ wearing nun’s habit with wimple/ kneels with rosary over joined hands raised in prayer before altar draped with cross-inscribed cloth on which is crucifix/Figure against spiraling filigree background within blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature in left column/ rubric label/ PAPELARDIE/Below miniature in left column/ champide initial U of Une decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ UNE YMAGE OT AP(RE)S ESC(RI)PTE / Q(UI) SAMBLOIT B(IE)N EST(R)E YPO(CR)ITE/2) Roman de la Rose: Poverty -- Youth/ representing Personification of Poverty/ name inscribed POURETE in rubric/ with right hand to face/ sits on ground between two trees/Figure against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature in right column/ rubric label/ POURETE/Below miniature in right column/ champide initial P of Povrete decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ POURV(RE)TE ESTOIT AU DERRENIER / POURETES Q(UI) I SEUL DENIER/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 5v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover speaking to Idleness -- Lover stands and gestures toward Personification of Idleness/ standing with right hand holding mirror reflecting her face/ and with comb in left hand/ To right/ crenellated tower with door/ surmounted by two trees/Scene against diapered background within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT OISEUSE P(AR)LE A L’AMANT/On fol/ 6r/ champide initial D of Dist decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ DIST ELLE A MES CO(N)NOISSANS / SI SUI RICHE FAME ET POISSANS/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 7r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Carol of God of Love -- Two couples hold hands/ including one veiled female/ the foremost woman is led by God of Love (Eros)/ crowned/ winged gesturing and looking back over right shoulder/ all following three male musicians blowing bannered trumpets/ one playing harp/ another man walking with arms crossed on breast/Scene against gold background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ LA KAROLE AU DIEU D’AMOURS/Below miniature/ champide initial L of La decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ LA VEISSIES VO(US) FLEUTEURS / ET MENESTRIER (ET) IOGLEE(UR)S/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 12r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover at Fountain of Narcissus -- Lover/ wearing belted tunic/ head propped on right arm/ reclines beneath tree on grassy hillock from which flows stream/ some water contained in rectangular pool/Scene against diapered background within blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT NARCISUS SE MIRE A LA FO(N)TAINE IL A EST LA FO(N)TAINE D’AMOURS SOUZ L’EPIN/Below miniature/ champide initial N of Narcisus decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ NARCISUS FUT DAMOISIAX / QU’AMO(UR)S TI(N)T EN SES ROISIAX/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 12v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover (or Narcissus) at Fountain of Narcissus -- Lover/ wearing tunic with belted purse/ kneels looking at reflection of his face in stream partly contained in rectangular pool/ flowing from grassy hillock beneath tree/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with tendrils on three sides/On fol/ 12r/ rubric caption of scene/ COMME(N)T NARCISUS SE MIRE EN LA FONTAINE/Below miniature/ champide initial A decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ A LA FO(N)TAINE TOUT ADENS / SE MIST LORS P(OUR) BOIRE DEDE(N)S/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 14r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Lover pierced by Arrow of God of Love -- God of Love (Eros)/ crowned/ winged/ with bow shoots arrow piercing eye of Lover/ wearing tunic with belted purse/ raising his hands; tree between them/Scene against diapered background within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ ET TRAIT A MOY DIT L’AMANT LE DIEU D’A(MOURS)/Below miniature/ champide initial E of Et decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ ET TRAIT A MOI P(AR) TEL DEUISE / Q(UE) P(AR) (M)I L’UEIL M’A OU CUER MISE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 23r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Reason speaking to Lover -- Before crenellated tower with opened door/ Personification of Reason/ wearing veil/ gestures toward Lover/ wearing tunic with belted purse/ also gesturing/Scene against diapered background decorated with fleur-de-lis within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CI DEUISE DE RAISON (ET) DES(CEND)A(N)TES BELLE FACON (ET) CO(M)ME(N)T ELE VIE(N)T P(OUR) CHATO J’ER L’AMANT RETRANE DE SA FOLLE (?)/Below miniature/ champide initial E of Ele decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ ELE OT EL CHIEF VNE COROUNE / B(IE)N RESAMBLA HAULTE P(ER)SO(U)NE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 27v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Shame and Fear confronting Danger sleeping in Garden -- Man representing Personification of Danger/ wearing hooded garment/ with club in left hand/ reclines with right hand to head on ground before Personification of Shame and Personification of Fear/ one veiled; one extends hands toward him/ and the other raises right hand; tree on grassy hillock/Scene against gold background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/In right column/ rubric caption of scene/ COM(M)ENT PAOUR (ET) HONTE VIEN(N)E(N)T A DANGIER QUI SE DORMOIT OU V(ER)GIER/Below rubric caption/ champide initial A decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils in left column/ at beginning of text A CE (CON)SEIL SE SONT TENUES / P(UIS) CE SONT A DANGIER UENUES/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 28v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Jealousy commanding Construction of Tower to imprison Welcome -- Personification of Jealousy/ wearing draped hat/ stands with right hand raised toward mason/ holding trowel with right hand/ standing on crenellated tower with windows/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature in right column/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT IALOUSIE F(A)IT FAIRE LA TOUR OU BEL AC(UEIL) FUIT MIS EN P(RI)SON/Below miniature in right column/ rubric speech/ L’AMANT P(AR)LE/Below miniature in right column/ champide initial M of Mes decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils in right column/ at beginning of text/ MES OR EST DROIS Q(UE) IE VOUS DIE / LA CO(N)TENANCE IALOUSIE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 30v
folio_text: Jean de Meun/ as scribe/ sits on high-backed chair and with both hands raises pen toward open book with pseudo-inscriptions on lectern/Figure against diapered background decorated with fleur-de-lis within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric/ CI CO(M)ME(N)CE LE ROUMA(N)S MAISTRE JEHAN DE MEUN/Below miniature/ champide initial E of Et decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ ET SI L’AI IE P(ER)DUE ESPOIR / A POU QUE IE NE M’E(N) DES(ES)POIR/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 37r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Wheel of Fortune -- Personification of Fortune/ crowned/ blindfolded/ stands with hands turning spokes of wheel around which are four male figures/ the first ascending the rim/ the second as crowned king/ seated with legs crossed on top/ the third descending the rim/ and the fourth/ partly nude/ wearing loin cloth/ recumbent/ grasping the bottom rim/Figures against gold background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT FORTUNE EST EN SA ROE LES YEX BE(N)DES ET LA TOURNE TOUT A SA UOLENTE/Below miniature/ champide initial C of Car decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ CAR LA DEBONNAIRE ET LA MOLE / LEUR VIE(N)T ET LEZ BOULE ET AFOLE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 53v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Friend comforting Lover -- Male Friend raises left hand and extends right forefinger toward Lover/ wearing tunic with belted purse/ gesturing/Scene against foliate patterned background within pink frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on both sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CI DIT L’AMANT CO(M)MENT AMIS REUIENT A LI SE(CON)DE FOIS POUR LI RECONFORTER/Below miniature/ champide initial A decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ A DONC D’AMIS ME RESOUUINT / ESU(ER)TUER ME RECOUUINT/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 68v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Jealous Husband beating Wife -- Husband raises club in right hand and with left hand seizes hair of wife raising hands and falling backward on her right arm/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature in left column/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT LI IALOUS BAT SA FE(M)ME/At beginning of right column/ rubric speech/ AMIS P(AR)LE/Below rubric in right column/ champide initial L of Lors decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ LORS LA PRENT ESPOIR DE VENUE / CIL QUI DE MAUTALE(N)T TRESSUE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 76r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Forced Abstinence and False Seeming before God of Love -- God of Love (Eros)/ crowned/ winged/ stands and gestures toward nun/ wearing veiled habit with wimple/ representing Personification of Forced Abstinence/ with book with two straps in right hand with rosary over arm/ with left hand extended to left hand of Dominican friar/ representing Personification of False Seeming/ tonsured/ wearing hooded habit/ holding staff with right hand/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CI DIT L’AMA(N)T CO(M)ME(N)T ABSTINE(N)CE CO(N)TRAINTE AMENA FAUS SA(M)BLANT PAR LA MAIN DEUANT LE DIEU D’AM(OUR)S/Below miniature in right column/ champide initial Q of Que with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ QUE CE DIST IL AI IE SONGIE /DI FA(US) SAMBLANT P(AR) QUEL (C)O(N)GIE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 79v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ God of Love presenting Crown to False Seeming -- God of Love (Eros)/ crowned/ winged/ stands with left hand lowered and with right hand extended to crown on head of Dominican friar/ representing Personification of False Seeming/ wearing hooded habit/ kneeling with joined hands raised/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT AMOURS RECOIT FAUS SA(M)BLANT ET LE FAIT ROY DE RIBA(ULX) DELA/In right column/ champide initial F of Faus with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ FAUS SA(M)BLANT P(AR) TEL COUUENANT / SERAS O MOI TOUT MAINTENANT/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 83r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ False Seeming cutting off Tongue of Slander -- Man/ wearing garment with hood/ representing Personification of Slander/ kneels with his head restrained by Dominican friar/ wearing hooded habit/ representing Personification of False Seeming/ seated on bench/ Behind them/ nun/ wearing veiled habit with wimple/ representing Personification of Forced Abstinence/ raises knife with right hand and with rosary suspended from left arm extends left hand to shoulder of the Slander/Scene against gold background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/On fol/ 82v/ rubric caption of scene/ CI DIT CO(M)MENT FAUS SEMBLA(N)T CONFESSE MALE BOUCHE ET CO(M)MENT IL LI COPE LA LA(N)GUE/In right column/ champide initial M of Male decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ MALE BOUCHE TANTOST S’ABESSE / SI S’AGENOU(I)LLE ET SE (CON)FESSE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 84r
