folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Old Woman bringing Wreath from Lover to Welcome -- Old Woman/ wearing kerchief-veil/ extends floral wreath toward Personification of Welcome/ peering from grated window of crenellated prison tower/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on three sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ (COM)MENT LA VIEILLE QUE GA(R)DE BEL AC(EUIL) LI A PORTE LE CHAPEL QUE L’AMANT LI E(N)VOIE PARLE (CON)SEIL DE FAUS SA(M)BLANT/On fol/ 84v/ champide initial B of Biau decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ BIAU FILZ DIST ELLE MOULT M’ESMAY / QUANT VOUS TRUIS EN SI GRANT ESMAY/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 99v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Welcome thanking Lover for Wreath -- Personification of Welcome gestures toward Lover/ wearing belted purse/ extending his hands toward her/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on right and left sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT BEL AC(UEIL) EST VENUS E(N)CO(N)T(R)E(R) L’AMANT ET LE MERCIE DU CHAPEL QUE LI AUOIT ENUOIE PAR LA UIEILLE/Below miniature in left column/ champide initial E of Enclins decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ ENCLINS LE SALUE DE VENUE / (ET) CIL AUSSI ME RESALUE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 103v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Battle with Guards of Castle -- Two soldiers/ wearing helmets and mail/ holding swords with hands/ one holding shield with left hand/ accompany Personification of Welcome/ crowned with wreath/ holding shield with left hand and with right hand holding spear/ all confronting two men/ including Personification of Danger/ raising club with left hand/ emerging from portal of crenellated tower/Scene against gold background within pink and blue frame decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/At lower left column/ rubric caption of scene/ CI CO(M)ME(N)CE LA BATAILLE DE LOST AU DIEU D’AMOURS CO(N)TRE LES PORTIERS DU CHASTEL/Below miniature in right column/ champide initial F of Franchise decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ FRANCHISE UINT P(RE)MIEREM(EN)T / CO(N)TRE DANGIER M(OU)LT HU(M)BLEM(EN)T/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 142r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Venus attacking Castle -- Venus/ crowned/ winged/ with bow shoots flaming torch at castle with closed portals/Scene against diapered background decorated with fleur-de-lis within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ SI CO(M)ME VENUS TRAIT AU CHASTEL UN BRANDO(N) DE FEU P(OUR) E(M)BRASER CEULZ ET SONT DEDANS/Below miniature/ champide initial L of Lors decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ LORS FU VEN(US) HAUT SECOURCIEE / B(IE)N SEMBLA EST(R)E COURROUCIEE/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 142v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Pygmalion making Image -- Pygmalion/ wearing tunic/ with chisel carves statue of recumbent woman/ eyes closed/ on table/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CI CO(M)MENCE HISTOIRE DE PYMALION ET DE SON YMAGE/Below miniature/ champide initial P of Pymalion decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ PYMALION TU ENTAILLIERRES / PORTRAIANS EN FUST ET E(N) PIERRES/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 145r
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Pygmalion embracing Image -- Standing statue of woman beside Pygmalion/ wearing tunic with belted purse/ embracing/Scene against diapered background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on one side/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)MENT PIMALION TROUUA SON YMAGE CONT VIF/Below miniature/ champide initial L of Lors decorated with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ LORS LI RESPONT LA DAMOISELE / QUI TANT EN AUENA(N)T (ET) BEL/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 145v
folio_text: Roman de la Rose: Scene/ Venus capturing Castle -- Two veiled women/ possibly Personifications/ follow male Personification of Danger/ wearing hood/ holding club with left hand/ all holding keys and departing from flaming crenellated castle with towers at left/ two looking back (Venus not present)/Scene against gold background within pink and blue frame of miniature decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Above miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CO(M)ME UENUS EMBRASA TOUT LE CHASTEL/Below miniature/ champide initial U of Uenus in right column with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text/ UENUS IN LA PLUS AT(T)ENDA(N)T / LE BRA(N)DON PLAIN DE FEU ARDANT/

tomb_text: Roman de la RoseFrance/ Paris/ between 1340 and 1350MS M/48 fol/ 150r
folio_text: Trinity: Mercy Seat -- God/ cross-nimbed/ seated on bench/ supports arms of tau-cross/ to which Christ/ nimbed/ eyes closed/ head inclined/ wearing long loin cloth/ bleeding from wounds in hands/ side and feet/ is affixed with three nails/ and above which dove of Holy Ghost descends toward the Christ’s head/ all flanked by husband and son on left and wife and daughter on right//Scene against diapered background/ within decorated pink and blue frame decorated with foliate tendrils on two sides/Margins decorated with rectilinear bars of ivy leaves and inhabited by hound on left and rabbit on right in lower margin (bas-de-page)/Below miniature/ rubric caption of scene/ CI CO(M)MENCE LI TESTAMENT MAISTRE JEAN DE MEUN QU’EST APPELE LI PEREZ ET LI FILZ ET LI SAI(N)T ESP(R)IT/Below rubric/ champide initial L of Li in left column with foliate ornament and tendrils/ at beginning of text of Jean de Meun/ Le Testament/ LI PERES ET LE FILZ / ET LE SAINS ESPERIS / UN DIEU EN TROIS PERSONNES/
